With a name like Oink you'd think they would get really creative but other than offering several eight types of bacon and maple glazed bacon donuts, they don't really seem to do all that much with it.   We ordered the bacon flight to sample all of the different types and then our individual meals. I had the 50/50 burger which is described as 1/2 ground bacon and 1/2 ground beef. It was good, but the bacon flavor wasn't nearly as tasty as I expected. My wife had two eggs and bacon which also came with hashbrowns. She noted that the hashbrowns were boring and the eggs and bacon weren't any better than other breakfast places. My kids ate pancakes and pigs in a blanket off of the kid's menu which didn't seem to include any specialty bacon offerings.  As stated, for a place that claims to specialize in pork products, there really didn't seem to be many. For a start, how about pork belly, bacon-flavored hot chocolate, or even just the ability to order a plate of a specific type of bacon. Yes, the bacon flight is nice but the presentation was lacking, basically just 8 strips on a plate. I'm sure a creative chef could come up with even more ideas.Right now Oink has a good name but they definitely need to work on the execution.
Bacon cooked perfectly. Eggs cooked perfect. I ordered the bacon Benedict and I always ask for the eggs to be cooked well. Awesome Bacon Bloody Mary! Very friendly staff.

I've been here a few times and service has always been good, but the food is inconsistent. I was here a few days ago and the server was excellent (never let my coffee run out!), my French toast was good, but the bacon was SO disappointing! It had zero flavor and looked like they had taken one piece and sliced it in half. They were 2 flimsy, skinny slices that looked like they came from a fast food place. I couldn't believe it. After the disappointment of this last visit I probably won't be back anytime soon.

I saw several health code violations in the 45 min I had the misfortune to eat here. Our waitress used a dirty glass to scoop ice out of the ice bin. The cook came out with his gloves on to speak to the table next to us, touched the table and walked right back into the kitchen. The waitress greeted our table with an armload full of dirty dishes. The bathroom was dirty, with no paper, and hadn't been checked (by the chart on the door) in 5 hours. This all on top of slow and rude staff made the visit not worth it. Entirely different from the same place in Tucson.

I have to agree with many of the other reviewers, food is good but the service is bad. The person in charge of the servers has got to be the problem.  I witnessed other tables having service issues. Lousy manager and/or lousy training program.  Won't last with that kind of program.
If I could give this place a negative star or none at all I would. First off the food is mediocre at best, and they put less effort into their customer service than I did writing this review.

I've been eagerly awaiting a good time to try this place out because, well, BACON! It's got a nice layout and the wait staff was extremely friendly. When I go to a place for breakfast one of the key factors to a good experience is if the wait staff can keep my coffee cup filled. Yeah for Autumn, our server. She did this for our whole table. I honestly could not decide on what to get so I told her to "Surprise me". Sometimes not a good idea, but I was pleasantly surprised. I was served the breakfast burger. Big hunk of meat and cheese with pepper bacon on a wheat bun. I was impressed at it's size however they forgot the egg on the burger and brought it on a separate plate a minute later. One of our party tried the "flight" of bacon and stated it was pretty good. I tried a piece of the Applewood and I liked it better than the pepper.   So my overall impression of Oink Café was good but not over the top. Forgetting an ingredient on a menu item is a no-no in any restaurant but I am glad they brought it. I would have never known. The coffee was good and the servers excellent. A little on the pricey side for breakfast for my taste. Over $80 for 5 of us. I'd like to go back and try lunch. Maybe I will do that soon.
Unique place! Great service. Had the chicken salad...YUM! Topped off with a bacon donut....different.

The last time I was here we had a big group and so the slower service made sense. But today it's just me and my friend. We asked if the bar was open seating and they said no. The hostess passed us over because she can't confirm what she heard.  In the meantime people just walked up and sat at the bar. Great....so we did the same. The problem is understaffing and mis-staffing. The bar guy is responsible for so much that he's super busy but others are standing around laughing, not rushing and most importantly not helping out. The food was decent but nothing special. The bacon of course is outstanding but the little things are missed.

I went  to Oink Cafe for the first time to have breakfast today at 10AM (on a Sunday) and it was really disappointing.   I shared 2 entrees and tried the bacon donut holes; while the flavor was good they were so dry that we didn't care much for them.   We shared the waffle combo and the paradise valley omelet with hash browns and a biscuit, this biscuit was dry, cold, and hard. The omelet was also dry and had clearly been under a warmer of some kind.  Hash browns were decent but nothing special. We chose this place because of the bacon and it was also disappointing.   For delicious pepper bacon, try Matt's Big Breakfast in downtown Phoenix. No comparison.   It was really surprising that during what should be a time to be rushing to fill orders, our food was not fresh at all.   My sister didn't ever receive part of her meal and then we had an extra beverage added to the check. The service was slow and scattered and there was no toilet paper in the women's restroom.   I won't be returning.

We had a great late lunch last week at Oink. Arrived about 30 minutes before their 2:00 closing but that made no difference. Our server, Suzie was wonderful.  Oink burger was HUGE, cooked to perfection topped with cheese, bacon (of course!) lettuce and tomato and served with a ridiculous amount of fries. My chicken wrap was amazing! We will be back!!!

Patience required. We go on Sundays and usually get there around 8:30am. Typically the wait is about 15 minutes. My favorite so far is the Oink Breakfast Burger and the Sweet Potato Fries. The service is usually slow. It's a very busy place and I'm an understanding person so it doesn't really bother me much but for someone in a rush it's probably not going to be a good choice for you. Good luck getting a refill on your water. My husband ordered the steak and eggs last time and he asked for his steak to be cooked medium well. When he got it the steak was more like medium rare...super pink and undercooked. So he was upset about that. The manager did offer to bring him a new dish, so that was nice.  Main reason we keep coming back is that we live so close. It's a decent breakfast, definitely better than Denny's.

My go to spot for sweet and savory breakfast. You can't beat their French Toast paired with one of the many bacon flavors. Bacon is obviously king at Oink and the jalapeno bacon is great. Once we went and they had a mango habanero bacon that was some of the best bacon I've ever eaten. If you're in the area and in the mood for some amazing pancakes, delicious french toast, or a phenomenal waffle, I highly recommend you stop by.

We waited 45 minutes for our food to arrive and our waitress wouldn't even come to our table to get our check when we were finished. We had to go inside to find someone to pay. They only took $5 off our bill!! Totally ridiculous to wait this long for eggs with no apology from our waitress!!! The manager was nice and the food was decent but very annoyed at this experience!

Wish I could comment on the food. 45 min wait. Never got seated as we were skipped several times. My wife and I didn't want to be crammed standing inside so we chose to sit outside in the heat.The staff is too lazy to check to see if people were waiting outside hence why we got skipped. Ended up walking out and they could have cared less. Got a lame ass sorry and that was it. Probably for the best. The place looked dirty anyways. Too many other clean and great places to eat that have far better customer service in the area.

I have been a years long fan of oink. The food is always amazing and the poached eggs are done to perfection. The crispest of bacon in SO many flavors! The service and management are super friendly and always remember me. I just recently had an issue with my check and they handled it with grace and a smile! This will continue to be one of my favorite places!!!! Way to go Oink!!!!
We stopped in for drinks only but the Bloody Mary flight was outstanding and the prices and serve matched the drinks.  Next time we will go for the bacon flight.

Tried out Oink Cafe for the first time today and really wanted to love it but it started off bad with our 20 minute wait turning into atleast a 40min. There were countless numbers of tables open during our wait time. When asked when we'd be called the lady said they'd already seated us, someone took our table! They immediately sat us. Our server was fabulous and food was good but wait time for the food was a little ridiculous. The poor servers are inundated with not only serving their tables but making their own drinks... this takes away from their tables and makes the wait that much longer. The organization seems to lack. Someone needs to help with hostess, check in's and calling people to their seats, they need to hire a drink maker. Hopefully we can give it a try again but not looking good.

The service was friendly but VERY poor.  We had to ask for water 4 times.  My friend ordered the Southwest omelette scrambled.  I created my own egg white scramble with spinach, tomato, jalapeno, pepper jack cheese and avocado.  We both ordered wheat toast and hash browns well done.  A different waiter brought us our breakfast. His was an omelet not scrambled but ate it anyway.  My was egg omelet not egg white scrambled no avocado, raw hash browns and no toast.  We sent it back but before we received it our original waiter brought us the check without checking on us and made a comment how I ate mine pretty fast.  The order came out again without the avocado, wheat toast and no jelly.  We had to ask twice for the bacon donut  holes (Yum!) which he finally brought but seemed a little confused as to what exactly they were.  He did have the manager remove our two Bloody Mary's.  We did noticed two other tables that this waiter had also had problems.  We will try this place again as the food was pretty good once we got it but hopefully we will get the right food at the same time and better service.
Food isn't that good and service was horrible. Very slow, server forgot to put in my entire order with the other orders at my table.

Wow. Just amazingly wow.   Located next to Paradise Valley Mall in the target strip mall is a little gem known as oink.  The signs walking up are descriptive and making me salivate for the bacon before I even walk in the door.  Looking at the menu I see there are several different bacon options and even a "flight" of bacon!!! Now most of us over 21 know a flight as a beer sampler with 4 or 5 different beers. But a Bacon flight... genius.   So after a mad cackling fit over the bacon flight I decide at 9am I must try the 50/50 burger. 50% ground beef and 50% ground bacon. Med is the lowest they will cook it due to the pork. Ok no problem. It comes out and I'm immediately drooling. Take a bite and I'm in heaven.  I ate half and was full. Took the other half for my 21 year old to have with his lunch. While I was sad the beautiful bacon aroma had left the car, I am happy to say I am still stuffed hours later.    I can't wait to return and try something else new.
Great place for breakfast. Staff is always friendly and the food is always good. This is one of our go to places when in Phoenix.

I've been to Oink a couple of times .... and I really hope it pulls through and makes it.    It's in a location where 'The Eggery' was in Paradise Valley for a long, long time and they were very busy and successful.  Several places have come and gone since then... and for some reason, I'm really routing for Oink, but they have a lot of work to do.   The parking is not exactly the best.   I would HIGHLY recommend you park in the EAST parking lot rather than the SOUTH.   If you enter from the south entrance, you have to walk all the way to the back (er, um, front?) of the restaurant to only walk back where you came from to be seated.  A little awkward, but I didn't learn my lesson from the first time I was there.     There is a cute little patio area that I hope they utilize someday... love sitting outside!    The restaurant atmosphere is a little sparse, but since it's just starting out, I hope they add more to the decor- because I love nice ambiance.   Right now it's bland and boring.     The food is great!  My co-workers enjoyed piled high sandwiches and build your own omlettes which they really liked.  I've tried their bacon cheeseburger, which was so good the first time, that I ordered it again.  Yes, I'm boring.   I also ejoyed their sweet potato fries.  If you're going to try this place... be sure to go with a huge dose of patience.  These girls are REALLY trying to get it right.  They are very pleasant, but I just don't think they've gotten their groove yet on service.      Ladies, work smarter, not harder.  For instance, grab silverware when you grab the menus, so you're not back and forth and running over yourself.    Maybe even have a service station closer to the back (er, um, front?) of the restaurant.  It's a long jaunt back and forth.   Anyways, I wish you the best of luck.  It has a great food with great potential!

Damn. If we truly are what we eat, I'm in trouble.  Anyone that reads my reviews knows I hold Matt's Big Breakfast at the top tier of breakfast places. Every time I go to Matt's I get friendly service and PERFECT breakfast...and they are the only place in the Valley that get's the 5 stars for breakfast (at least in my book).   That being said, we have been to Oink Cafe a few times and are impressed.   This is a bacon place. They have about 8 different kinds of bacon, and all are really yummy.   The Omelettes are pretty damned good, I have to say. The Country Potatoe's are really good, as well. The egg and meat (think bacon) dishes are very good.   So, if you can't make it to Matt's, come here. They're on to something, and it's very, very good.

Food always good here & servers are friendly but I wish they had a someone to buss tables. Seems like the servers can't keep up with it any time I'm here. It's gross walking by dirty table after dirty table. This would detract from a 4 star review but my server was so nice I had to up from 3 to 4 stars.

Nice place to get some Breakfast or Lunch in the PV Mall area. Inside is somewhat simple with the basic PIG theme (Oink). They have both booths and tables that you can request. Gets really busy and you will probably have to wait a bit. So get there a little early and get your name on the list. We went shopping next door and got back right when they called our name. Perfect timing.  The menu has a large selection of most of your favorite breakfast dishes as well as a lunch menu with burgers and sandwiches. They also serve soup, an array of salads, oatmeal, yogurt with granola, mac and cheese, chicken, fish and chips, and even chicken fried steak.  Today my Yelp friend and I did the breakfast dance. I ordered the The OINK Omelette which has 5 eggs and is stuffed with a bunch of the meat group covered with cheddar cheese. Had to try a side of the Half Flight of Bacon which is 4 out of the 8 choices of flavored Bacon strips and a side of what they call ranchero sauce for my omelette.  Our server Cheyenne was both friendly and most accommodating even though the restaurant was totally packed. She made sure that we had everything we needed and then some.  The food was tasty yet somewhat average and the bacon was a little pricey. Would have liked a thicker cut of the Bacon as well as it being cooked a little slower to prevent shrinkage. After all it is served on a butcher block. Thick BABY! The Omelette was tasty and quite filling. What they call ranchero sauce is really more of a New Mexico style enchilada sauce. Ranchero sauce is usually more of a fresh sauce cooked with tomatoes, onion, peppers, garlic and herbs. I bet their version would taste great on one of their burrito options. Hmm?  Definitely worth a visit when you are shopping and getting ready to drop. Open every day from 7 am to 2pm. Enjoy!
Affordable breakfast food with the most delicious bacon ever! Also, perfect fries, not soggy and not too crunchy! Will come back!

Let's start with that I love this place.  The only reason I give it 4 stars is that there is a serious lack of staff. It's either not enough wait staff or not enough cooking staff. I'm not really sure. This place is always packed. It's always a minimum 20 minute wait to get seated and then when you're seated, it takes another 10 to get your drink and then another 10 for your order.   Personally they need to add wait staff. They are working far too many tables per waiter/waitress. If they added 2 to a shift, they could churn people in and out of here. Bus boys wouldn't hurt either.   Overall great food, great location and great setting but too understaffed for the amount of business they get.

SUCH good food! Incredible kinds of bacon. EIGHT KINDS OF BACON. Rachel was our server and she was fantastic!!! Super friendly, and she was super prompt with getting us drinks even though the restaurant was busy! We had the chorizo and eggs, and the oink french toast. Pictures posted below!

Was hoping to be blown away by the maple bacon donut, but it was dry and lacking in maple flavor. Had a couple good bites but other bites not. The other more standard fare items were enjoyed. Pancakes, omelettes, etc were good. Little slow on the service with one large table of single checks slowing things up.

We live in the area and were pleased to see a new breakfast place opening. It seems to be a locally owned small business and we find the best food and service in this type of establishment. To borrow from William S. Burroughs writing about the Rio Grande Valley; ""In the Valley, restaurants are not operated by people who are cookers and purveyors of food. They are opened by somebody who decides that "people always eat" so a restaurant is a "good deal".""  The owners may have restaurant experience, but it's not apparent. The staff is young, and doesn't  seem to know how sit-down breakfast works. They probably grew up eating from the McDonalds drive-up window. We got coffee and placed our order, and never saw the waitress again until she was ready to give us the bill. Our coffee was gone long before the food came, someone in a black uniform (one of the owners?)  brought the food to us, but didn't see our coffee cups were empty. The waitress never came over to ask us if everything was OK. She did ask if we wanted the check when she saw our plates were empty. At that point she asked if we wanted more coffee. A quick fix would be to take the owners and waitstaff across the street to I-HOP for breakfast so they could see what they should be doing.

Recently moved from Columbus, Oh to Phoenix. Drove the whole way. On our second or third day here we went to The Oink for breakfast. It was the first time since leaving Ohio that we had great service. In fact our server was so good she was probably one of the best ones I've ever had. I didn't catch her name unfortunately but she was a really tall brunette.     She was so friendly right from the get go and you could tell she knows what she's doing. It was almost like she was reading my mind with the coffee I wanted, even offered to give me a cup to go. My boyfriend and I were so stressed from the road and being in a new place that we weren't that high-spirited when we came in and she made my day.  And the food was delicious! I got the oink omelette and he got the Arizona omelette and pancakes and we loved our food. The fruit was really good too. My omelette was even good reheated. I only got through 1/4 of it so I had plenty of leftovers to eat later on. The sauce on the Arizona omelette was so good that I snagged some from my boyfriend's plate to use on mine. I will definitely be back there and hopefully get that same server because she was phenomenal

I had a pleasant valley omelette with bacon cheddar cheese and spinach. The presentation was rustic and the omelette was flat and greasy. Server was testy to start but warmed up over time.  Lots of options for sides and toast. If in area would give a second try but would not search it out.

Loved this place so much.  I was there with my husband, 4 year old and three 8 yr old girls. We were there on a friday afternoon and had no wait. I ordered the special french toast ( guess what its crusted in). It was so good, everyone tried a piece and I still had leftovers. The portion sizes are huge! (a good thing). My husband got the Huevos rancheros and they were spicy and greasy just the way they should be. I can't wait to go back and try the bacon pancakes!! Oh and my favorite was the cute menu with tiny pink pigs showing what has bacon in it.

Took a visit to Oink Cafe on a work lunch.  Very unique atmosphere. Pig and bacon shrines everywhere. We ordered a flight of bacon to share. Some of them were pretty interesting. I particularly enjoyed the jalapeno bacon and apple cider bacon.  I got the ranchero chimichanga. A giant mess of pork and cheese. Not bad at all, but nothing to write home about. I would consider the breakfast options next time.

Breakfast was delish!  I had the Oink Chimi with a side of hash browns (see pic). It came hot and I actually had to wait a bit to eat (I love that - nothing worse than paying for Luke warm food). The portions were so big I could only eat half. The pork inside was very good (slow cooked in bacon grease - c'mon man!) and the chorizo sauce on top added a lot of flavor. My wife had the Oink French toast and also could only eat half. The raspberry and blueberry sauce was a perfect topping.   One minor thing:  We ordered half a 'flight' (lol) and picked the applewood, pepper and sugar bacon. The bacon was very good but...Both my wife and I could barely tell a difference between the flavors. Thought there would be a noticeable difference especially when you have sugar and pepper.   Service was friendly, fast and consistent. Ambience was casual and clean.   Would definitely come back!

I was really looking forward to this place.... Won't be back. We ordered biscuits and gravy and chorizo and eggs with a side of turkey and bacon. It took 50 min for the food to come out and when it did everything was cold. The sparse sausage gravy  was lumpy and bland, and the biscuits were dry.   On the chorizo and eggs, my dining companion said they were 'okay' mind you that the waitress had said that the reason for the wait on the food was because they were making "fresh Chorizo'' we wondered if they meant they were mid slaughter being as it took so long to arrive. But then it was just OKAY? yeah, not good enough.   When the food came out the waitress dropped the side of turkey sausage, which ended up being a blessing because, though it took 10 more minutes to get a new order, at least it was hot.   We won't be going back.

Everyone was def right about trying the bacon flavor sampler with 8 different flavors. I loved jalapeño and maple, but they were all very good. In addition, we had great service . The manager came around and checked on everyone including us. She was delightful and made great conversation. Perfect mixture between amazing food and great service. Also- she told us one is opening in Tucson if you live there!
Its ok.. love the bacon.. for sure -- other then just another normal breakfast place.. really packed ! great servers!

I don't like how their tables are set up. Booths against the side of the walls, with individual tables in the aisle. Not the best set up if you're there by yourself because everybody's staring at you and makes for awkward dining experience.  Some of the wait staff are very rude, and yet some are very friendly. I saw they automatically gave every other table in the place free glasses of water. I didn't get any free glasses of water. I wish some of the rude wait staff would quit or get fired, because they give the place a bad rep. They do have a good manager who is helpful with customer requests.   Good mix of customers. Not too many old people, not too many kids, not too many business people there, just a good mix of customers. I didn't feel uncomfortable or out of place there. Will probably be back.

Service was fine but food is not impressive.  I ordered the california omelette. A dry egg omelette with small chunks of unflavored chicken paired with cheap tasting pepper jack cheese, jalapeños and topped with two small slices of avocado. The flavors do not mingle at all and I was not impressed in any way.  Props for having gluten free toast.  The hash browns are like cubes of French fries. Unimaginative except for the addition of some browned onions that are too sparse to add much flavor. *** I'm sorry I had the Homefries. The Homefries were like cubes of fries. ****  Service was fine.  Coffee was dark at least.  Wouldn't come back based on flavor alone.

I enjoyed this place very much! Every time I go, it's always busy and there's usually a wait. Sometimes the wait isn't long and some times it is... but i definitely feel like the wait is worth it.  Everything revolves around bacon... I mean who doesn't love bacon right!? I tend to find myself always ordering their Oink French toast. And can I just say, how DELICIOUS AND OMG!!! Their French toast is!?!!! It's coated with this golden brown deliciousness... (I know what it's coated with but I'll have y'all figure that one out...) and it's covered with blueberries and topped with whipped cream. Definitely no syrup needed because it is perfectly sweet all on its own.
Had the biscuit and gravy with eggs! OMG... the best ever. Wife had the blueberry pancakes... love them!!

It was a Monday at 10 am. We were seated outside. Another couple was seated after us right next to us.  After 15  minutes they had water/coffee and ordered. We didn't even have the server that sat us ever come back and a knowledge our presence.  We simply got up and left, I mean what's the point of complaining when people are making your food??

We stumbled on this place by accident while on vacation in Phoenix. The sign that said "breakfast, lunch, bacon" caught our eye cause who doesn't love bacon? We walked in and I realized that it was 1:48 and their closing time was 2:00. I said "oh I'm sorry I see it's about closing time," but the hostess said "nonsense! Please take a seat." Everyone was so friendly at this place. We had great service and the food was wonderful. We started off with a maple bacon doughnut that my husband talked about for days afterward. The kids ordered breakfast food- the pancakes and french toast were great. I had a salad that was good as well. We left stuffed and very satisfied and would love to eat here again if we are ever in the area
I'm not a huge breakfast person to start with, but they had really good food. I got fresh orange juice, which was satisfying. The hash browns and grilled cheese was a good. Staff was pleasant.

We like the name but this is the first time I persuaded my wife to check it out. We sat outside on a pleasant morning. We an an excellent server. We started with a bacon bloody mary: better than it sounds. I had the oink omelette though the dog is getting a big part of it. My wife had a blt which was mostly bacon.  We missed bacon covered pastry and the bacon flight which is 8 pieces of bacon, one of each kind sold.   The only problem was that my plate apparently waited for the omelette as toast and hash browns were barely warm. All the food tasted good.

This cafe serves good brunch fare, perhaps a tad pricey but the food is definitely tasty and satisfying. The service is very friendly and the atmosphere is casual ... I was about to say relaxed, but then I remembered how crowded it gets on weekends and the wait can be quite long during those times. Unless you plan to come early on weekends, weekdays are probably the best days to try this place out.

I work close by, so I've ordered to go breakfast a couple times now. Food is fantastic. I've already let all my foodie friends on my side of town know that this place is a must. I get the bacon Benedict with the jalapeño bacon and hash browns. Definitely my favorite so far. Their chai tea latte was good, today I had just plain coffee and that was good too. The time estimate they give me is always accurate as well. My only complaint is that the place is very busy and the girls seem stressed, perhaps a little extra help for them would be a good idea (:

Was in the area for vacation, July 2015. It was okay, not a knockout, although the staff was extremely helpful and pleasant. Bacon was not what you would expect from a establishment specializing in America's favorite meat!   Taste like slices you could get at any diner or restaurant around the country.

A plethora of bacon choices and busy at 10:30 for breakfast is always good news.  A counter gives a modern place an old school feel not to mention a decent patio.  This is a perfect idea and needed breakfast option for the area.

WARNING: My family and I never got to try the food.  I have never written a negative review and I am sad that a new place has to be my first.  So my husband has been waiting for this place to open for a month.  He booked opening weekend on the calendar and invited the whole family.  The four of us (toddler and teen as well) arrived about 10am.  There was no one to greet us and looked like they had a number (maybe 6) of families waiting.  After a few minutes a (teen?) girl came over and kind of took our name.  No information, no wait time, no menus (which we took to look over ourselves).  Noticed tables sitting empty but not cleared.  Another couple waiting next to us for 10 minutes ended up finally having their server come over and hand them their bill.  Interesting...  We waited for over a hour.  In that time no one saw a bus boy.  The two tables were never cleared of their slowly rotting food in that entire time (though the "greeter" girl came over to the same table twice, clearing 1-2 cups each time...).  A few groups were slowly seated as we waited, but we also noticed the outside tables were empty but no one was being asked to sit outside.  About 30 mins in, the greeter girl came over to see if anyone wanted to sit outside (should have been done from the start.).  As she looked for people, she rolled her eyes when she couldn't find the name from her list.  When we were finally seated (by the same greeter...), the table soaking wet.  She grabbed some paper towels and handed them to my son, who dried the table himself.  No silverware was on the table so a few minutes later, one of the owners/managers put some down.  He half-heartedly (and inappropriately if I may add) said "Guess you waited awhile?".  I said it looked like their were some logistics issues and he immediately shot back that "No, we are very busy".  Um, if you cannot handle your shop being busy, than yes - you have logistics issues.  My husband asked if there were any busboys and he said there were three and they were all working.  Wrong attitude all around - this is not how to endear your customer base.  After he walked off, my son noticed the silverware had dried egg on several pieces and that the 5-6 tables nearest to us had NO food on them - all the families were waiting without menus.  That was the last straw.  As the waitress came over for the first time to ask for our drink requests, I explained it was not needed as we were leaving.  It sounds like the food here could be excellent.  But they need someone with major restaurant management experience to get these things ironed out immediately.  Additionally, management needs to realize that their attitudes can make or break their business.  I love supporting local shops and I wish them the best.  However, I will wait for more yelp feedback to determine if we will ever return.  P.S.  In going over my review with my husband and son, he said he has a few friends that went over the weekend with their families as well.  One said they waited over 1.5 hrs only to get the wrong items delivered to their table, with no explanation of what happened or apology.  Very disappointing...

Great way to celebrate International Bacon Day! Started with their signature Bacon Bloody Mary which could be a meal all on its own. My table shared the flight of bacon. So good! I order the Stuffed Pork Loin Benedict special. AMAZING! A delicous and very creative way to present a benedict. Service at the Oink is always very friendly. If you haven't been yet you should..... Go get your Oink on!
Amazing service great food.  Family friendly.  Bacon donut was the best!  We Were going to go to ihop but saw this and went on a whim.  So glad we made the choice we were not disappointed

I went here with my wife and couple of our friends during the Sunday morning breakfast rush. This place was very busy, and I could see why. The reason? Bacon. Need I say more?  So I totally pigged out. I figures, what the heck. New place? Let's go knee deep.   I had The Oink Omelette. I used to be a fat kid, so I felt my old self pop out.   Five eggs, with bacon, sausage, ham and cheddar cheese. With hash browns. How I didn't keel over with a heart attack, I don't know. In my defense! I didn't eat the whole thing!   But I did eat a lot. The servers here were so friendly! There was an older woman in particular who I noticed calling people by their names. She was very attentive with refilling coffee and water.   Next time, I think I'll try their jalapeno bacon.
Bacon! Bacon!  And more Bacon!  Even the donuts are made out of bacon.  It is really quite good though not spectacularly so.  -2 stars if you are a vegetarian.

After passing this place numerous times, I finally had a chance to visit for brunch. It's a basic breakfast cafe. Nothing too fancy but not divey either. A perfect place to meet friends for a quiet lunch or breakfast. It's also very child friendly. I had the california chicken sandwich and it was very good! It was a nice sized chicken breast , with bacon, cheese, and green chile. I've never had green chile on a chicken sandwich and it was sooo good!  I couldn't eat it fast enough. I ordered my son the chicken fingers which were the right amount of chicken and breading. My companions both had french toast and were very happy. The service was prompt and friendly. Overall a fun experience that I will definitely try out again.
From the moment you walk in the door it's a great experience happy efficient staff and awesome food!  What more can you ask for!! A definite first choice!!

Amazing French toast. It's seriously the best French toast I've ever had. I don't even care about anything else. The service was good. The French toast was great. My friend had the pork Benedict. She loved it.

Had to Give only 2 stars today...asked for eggs over medium not running and 1/2 cooked !!!! Hash Browns and Bacon were good and also warm , Sourdough Toast was just Okay seemed like Oil put on it though...Dissapointing Breakfast this morning for the Oink

Entered the establishment, was told to sit anywhere I wanted,  did so in a booth. Sat there for 15 minutes like the invisible man.even waving arms could  ot catch the attention of any waitstaff.  No coffee  no water  no menu,  nothing. I'm happy at I hop now across the street. They took 15 minutes of my life. They won't get my money.

This is such a unique place!  The atmosphere is fun and casual, but it's a nice enough place to take the parents to.  It's sorta like Denny's meets Starbucks as far as being nice.  I had a maple bacon donut and it was amazing.  I have never been a fan of putting bacon on pancakes, but that's precisely what this tasted like without being being overpowering in any way.  Also great cappuccinos.  The wait staff are awesome, and once I forgot to tip them but they were so graceful about it.

There was a wait and that's to be expected. 40 minutes. The part that took just as long was to get our food. -1 star. We had 3 kids so after sitting out side waiting and coming in and waiting... Just not fun. -1 more star for very ordinary food all around the table. I do however regret not getting a bacon flight! I just might have to come back and give it another shot. But if your in the mood for an ordinary breakfast joint I say you will be pleased! I did love the Pigs colored by kids posted on the wall! Gave us something to look at! (Also has a decent patio. I love patios ;) )

Tried Oink Cafe on a whim today with some friends, and may I say -- OMG!!! I absolutely LOVED this place! The wait staff was absolutely on point and extremely friendly. The owner happened to be in also, and came over and chatted with us for a bit also which made us feel extra special. As far as the food goes, the Paradise Valley omelet was phenomenal and I could taste the freshness -- I also substituted the applewood smoked bacon for the jalapeno bacon (they have 8 different flavors of bacon). We also tried the bacon maple donut -- this is an absolute MUST TRY!!!! Oink Cafe exceeded our expectations and I will definitely be returning again.

I have been wanting to come to this place for almost a year.  I was so happy when Monica O. set up the Breakfast Club at this location.  We had a huge table,  our server was great, having to take care of such a large table can be overwhelming, and she was trying really hard to be on top of everything.  I had the French Toast Combo, which gave the the option to have two slices of my choice of bacon, I had the jalapeño and the honey cured.  Both, really great.  I have not had bacon in months.  My husband chose his meal from the lunch menu, so he was in heaven, he is not so fond of breakfast food, so he was thrilled when our server told him it was ok to order from the lunch menu.  He had the pull pork sandwich with sweet potato fries, he ordered the fries just for me, so I could try them.  I love sweet potato fries.  I had four or five, so yummy.  Can't wait to come back, and next time I will bring the twins.

I like this place!   When I was growing up, my Mother and Grandmother, were determined to put weight on me with their hamburgers.  There'd usually be a 1/2 pound of meat covered with the freshest condiments you might ask for.  Having come from a dairy ranch where they got the freshest beef you could ask for,  any beef they bought had to be up to their standards.  I ate well when we had hamburgers.  My mushroom with swiss burger was the first I have had in a long  time that brought back those child hood memories.  The Burger itself is really to big for two hands to hold and I have large hands.  So the bottom bun got soggy.  The beef was fresh enough for it to get that way as you bite into the beef and tastes good in the process!  My friend had a burger with bacon on it.  They have eight kinds of bacon to choose from.  She had sugar cured and it was thick cut and yummy.  I am going to go out on a limb and say I think the Oink has the best burgers in Phoenix!
My grandma and I come to oink all the time and Iw love it! The have the best Benedict in town!

Been here three weeks in a row and every time the food is consistently good! All three times it has been really busy but that never changed how good everything is! Service is great, food comes out fast, and coffee is good! If you don't like crowds and super loud environment then bring a jacket (when it's cold) and sit on the patio! Well worth the chill.   Ps skip the bacon flight and just eat the Jalapeño bacon mmmm  Pss and the poinsettia which is champs and cranberry juice

Took a group of 8 here this morning for brunch. Our server was great. I had my usual strawberry chicken salad and it was delicious! Others had breakfast items. We all left full and happy. Will definitely come back.

We have been a few times over the past year or so. In the past we have stopped in for breakfast and the omelettes have been quite good. The other day we stopped in for lunch which I can only say was that is was just  "ok". My son ordered a waffle off the kids menu and they made him the adult size. I knew he couldn't eat it all but he was thrilled when it arrived. I ordered the turkey sandwich and found myself looking to make sure the turkey actually made it on to the sandwich. Had they just put on a little more I would have enjoyed it but there were sections of the sandwich that were meatless and there wasn't enough to spread out to cover the entire piece of bread. The fries were decent and the server was friendly and quick to refill our drinks when needed.  Maybe it was just an off day. Since our previous experiences have been good we will certainly give it another try.

I was probably the only person to go there and not order any bacon. What was I thinking???   I was thinking of their delicious freshly made biscuits and sausage gravy. That's what I was thinking. If I had four stomachs I could have finished my breakfast and gotten a few slices of bacon. Go hungry. Really hungry as portions are huge and you are going to be ant to the at it all.   Mom had the French toast with strawberries blueberries and whipped cream. The French have nothing on this breakfast.  Lol. Amazing. I can't decide which one I like more so I'm going back for another test. Maybe a few more breakfast just to make sure which one is my fave. I do know this is my new fave breakfast place in north Phoenix.

Overall review?: go try EGGstasy.  So everything is homeade & pancakes were fluffy, the flight of bacon has 8 strips that don't have a lot of difference, you can taste the jalapeño and peppered bacon flavors but the sugar and honey cured weren't too different. The pecanwood and applewood were truly the only real flavored bacons that were different.    We ordered the florentine Benedict with honey cured bacon and strawberry pancakes, they were fluffy but not extraordinary. There was a bit of shortage on the sauce too.  Then they forgot the bacon on the Benedict so it tasted very plain until they brought the bacon which still just made it just... ok.  In summary, you could probably make a similar breakfast at home. If you want a special Benedict, do any of them from EGGstasy if you plan to wait 30-40 minutes on any day & the same goes to pancakes.  You could go to butter fields for better pancakes too.  There's just not any "you must stop here" for bacon or breakfast per the wow factor that is out there.  Not sure what they made for the guy from cnn...  The server was great but seating took quite awhile... I think that's more due to people camping out. They were busy in the beginning but there was plenty of people to ask how things were afterwards- and while we told them they said "next time we'll bring you more sauce".  I guess that's ok... Still nothing I'll be back for sadly.

First time here. Got here early thankfully 830 am. It was already busy but a line formed soon after. I tried the pork confit benedict. Everything was just fine. I didn't try any bacon though and will next time. Enjoyed a traditional house bloody mary perfectly spiced, didn't have to add anything. Got some bacon donut holes to go. Tried one when I got home, was drier than I thought it would be, not sure if it was supposed to be that way though. Would have been great on ice cream. Service was friendly, lots of families too so good for everyone.
Pretty basic breakfast food, fast service.  Food was a bit greasy for my personal liking.
Great food. Had the phoenix omelette. It was great. Prices were not bad. Service was great.

My friends and I went to The Oink Cafe for an impromptu birthday breakfast. To their credit, we were pleasantly surprised. We were sat in a timely fashion and the server steered us towards ordering macchiatos instead of just coffees. The bacon platter was awesome. My favorite were the jalapeno bacon strips. The country fried steak came highly recommended, and it did not disappoint. Their staff was friendly, the restaurant was clean, and the food and service was terrific! This place is worth every penny!

Can't speak to the food, because we decided to leave after waiting 20 minutes without being greeted or getting a drinks order, while watching multiple tables around us get served first, despite arriving after us. There only seemed to be one server for a section of 12 tables. The ambiance wasn't great - it was extremely loud and chaotic. Not a good spot for a relaxing breakfast or brunch.

I was very unhappy with this place. I ordered the biscuits and gravy after reading all the reviews, and was highly disappointed. I would think for a place that specializes in pork the sausage in the gravy would of been much better. But it tasted low quality. And the biscuits themselves where very dry. Wouldn't recommend to anyone who actually knows what good food taste like.

We came here for a cup of coffee and decided to order some eggs and bacon. Clearly bacon is their strong suit and the coffee was really very good as well.  I decided to come back the next day and see if yesterday was a fluke. Since we generally liked our original visit over a year ago but at the time we found things somewhat uneven.  Well the good news to report is that since my first visit with fellow Yelp'ers and Pepper Head Mark, things have improved. Service can be a bit slow during busy periods, they have definitely improved. The sad sausage I had eighteen months ago has been retired. It's been replaced by a very flavorful one (see photos).  Today we ordered the French Toast and the Oink's French Toast. The latter is just over the top sweet and a bit too much for this gourmand. While the regular French Toast would be enjoyed by every Gourmet as being just right. Look that up in your Roget's. LOL  Expect to pay $15 each if you don't order a 4 piece (1/2 flight) or 8 piece (full flight) of their absolutely delicious thick flavored bacon. If you do, and I would recommend that you do, then expect to pay accordingly, around $22-$25.  But ohhh, but it's sooo worth it!  Enjoy!

They chose the appropriate name for this cafe!!   Oink is accurately descriptive for how I felt trying to consume half my meal!!  The waitress even asked me if there were enough hash browns if you can believe that!!  Perfectly poached eggs and the bacon variety was surprising.  Jalapeño is my favorite kind of bacon now and will try to find my own to make my own BLT with avocado for lunch!!   Love the availability of getting local brews for breakfast.   Incredibly kind wait staff.   A great place to have breakfast.  I will definitely return for lunch soon.   Great cafe!!!

The idea is great and what inevitably will get you to try Oink Cafe.  The hostess staff and most employees seem to have better things to do than be at work.  I ordered the BLT.  It is listed as one of their specialties. The waitstaff asked what type of bacon I wanted as they offer eight flavors.  I stated Applewood, but changed my mind and said, bring whatever you recommend.  The BLT came out in three layers of blah wheat bread.  I'm pretty sure it was a 99 cent loaf of bread and the bacon had no flavor at all.  The manager came around and asked how our lunch was, I told him it was okay.  He said just ok and I told him my thoughts; the meal was rather bland.  He said, hopefully, they can impress better my next visit.  They won't have that opportunity.  Where we can order bacon everything from specialty store, don't eat here if you want some Jimmy Dean packaged bacon.

One of my favorite breakfast spots in Phoenix!  Bacon and sausage are just below filet mignon on my list of favorites.  Oink has several different sausage varieties, a few different types of bacon and everything else is delicious too!  I have had the pigs in a blanket, omelets, French toast... they were all excellent.  This is one of the spots we take guests when they visit.  You wont leave hungry and it's got some character which really sets it apart from your average corporate chain restaurant!

They have breakfast and lunch pretty well figured out. They don't have *everything*, but what they do, they do well.  We've had the bad luck of having one certain server several times that isn't as good as the others. Doesn't ask what kind of bacon you want of the eight choices, nor which  sides for sandwiches. She couldn't figure out how to accommodate a flavored green tea.

Bloody mary flights and they also do mimosa flights.  Not to mention a good value breakfast.  Indoor and limited outdoor seating.  Cyclist friendly for after ride protein.  Thai chili was my favorite but all had a unique flavor and very tasty.

A flight of bacon, pigs can fly. Yummy, it was 8 different types of bacon.  My 11 year old son claimed it was the best Hot Chocolate Ever, he is hard to please. The staff was friendly and professional, moderate pricing for a great breakfast. I just moved into the area, I shall return often. Closes at 2:30pm, no late lunches.
The caramel bacon glazed donut was awesome!

Breakfast was awesome. Service was a little slow, but the place was packed. We didn't have to wait long for a table on a late Sunday morning.   Overall I was really impressed by the restaurant. Decor was funky and the menu was unique.
I love this place! Great food, nice servers! I wish they were open later :)

This little cafe tucked in the PV mall area is cute and convenient. I love that I can come here with my dog (open patio), order a heathy breakfast without sounding like a you-know (they have an egg white/no cheese omelet option), OR just go all out on an indulgence if the mood strikes. The staff is friendly, the place is always clean, and the decor is cute (they fully embrace their inner piggly spirit animal). I've always had consistent service and quality here; I recommend.

The Oink Cafe is still young so I am hoping for improvements, not so much with the food, but really with the service.   I met a client there one morning for breakfast and although the service was okay, the food was wonderful. I decided to go back the next day for breakfast again and try the French Toast this time. I went to the hostess stand and waited to be seated. I stood there and stood there. I even had a waitress that was standing by the bar doing nothing look right at me and look away. Finally, another waitress running food told her to seat me and she came over and did. I had the French Toast. It was terrific! I wish they had let the bread soak a little longer, but for the most part it was delicious!   I took my husband there the next Saturday and just more service problems. The waitress again was rough. My husband's omelet  was wonderful but the home fries were cold. You could tell they sat getting cold until the omelet was done. My French Toast was good, but really dry. Again they didn't let it soak long enough.   The concept is great and the food is terrific, but there is still some operational issue that need to be worked out. Better training of the waitresses or better waitresses. The kitchen seemed to struggle during the busy weekend compared as to when I was there during the weekday. I will go back as the food is really good and I hope that they mature!

Yum...such a great breakfast place in Paradise Valley!  We stopped in with another couple and both of our dogs.  The staff was so welcoming and accommodating.  They seated us at the perfect, shaded table, brought water for our dogs and quickly took our order.  I thoroughly enjoyed my healthy choice omelet with a side of honey cured bacon - wow, was that good!  I can't wait to come back and try the flight of 8 different types of bacon...if the other 7 are as good as the 1 I tried, we are in for a treat.

I wish I could give no stars. This was the worst service I have ever had in my life. Took 30 minutes just to take our order, messed up the order twice. The waitress then took my plate while I was still eating. I will never eat there again.

Bacon flight is a must. The bacon maple donut was surprisingly good. It was served warm and we cut it in 5 as a appy for breakfast. Servers were overwhelmed with a huge Sunday crowd but still kept things moving. The shape of the space and decor is off-putting, others in my party loved it. The omelet was great, hash browns were a bit salty, greasy and room temperature The coffee was S+*^bucks type of "over strong", the current trend but not my fav. I'll take a smooth cup o joe any day. The bacon alone is worth the trip.

If I could eat here every day, I would... food is amazing, drinks are amazing, and the staff is amazing... really friendly customer service . I can't wait till I go back. Bloody Mary's is something I would recommend here. Flight of bacon as well..

Great place to get a mimosa or bacon bloody merry :-) I'm a regular at this place because of good food and great breakfast.....the staff is always friendly....but...unfortunately the customers are always rude. I've witnessed table hawks and pushiness on numerous occasion.....I've sat at the bar and had people hover over my food and try to force feed me just to get my stool.....I guess that's because this is a popular neighborhood place.

I have been here a few times and the food has always been delicious! Ive eaten their bacon, pancakes, waffles, and french toast. Only giving 4 stars because the hostess had a bit of an attitude, but the food made up for it!

The food is worth the wait. We had a great breakfast this morning. Close to ACU. Go Firestorm. Our server did a great job. I think her name was Taylor. I did overhear a guy complain about they were quoted 30 minute wait and it took 45 minutes. What did he expect. There was a line out the door. Can't wait to go visit my daughter so I can take her back.
The food was awesome and our server Josie was great. We went on Mothers Day and it was packed but we still got great service. The eggs Benedict was amazing. We will definitely come back.
Food is usually pretty good. The jalepeno bacon is amazing if cooked right. The service is usually pretty slow though. The manager is always visible and very nice.

This place is great. The food is excellent and the staff is pretty good too. The chai latte is amazing. I always end up getting two. The only downside is the tables aren't always cleaned; I have asked to switch tables a few times due to this.
Best Mac cheese anywhere!!!  The service was fast and friendly, and the prices are SO reasonable!!

Walking into Oink, you'll discover it's anything but a pigpen. Clean, minimalist design, wide open aisles, bright atmosphere. The menu is simple, but lots of bacon choices. Prices are moderate, food quality is excellent. Most breakfasts include choice of hash browns, cottage cheese or even fruit at no additional charge. Coffee is simply standard old brewed restaurant coffee, but they do have specialty espresso based drinks, that I did not try. I will definitely be back.

I guess this place is known for their bacon? Other than their many bacon-infused menu items I wouldn't really get that vibe, I ordered a side of applewood smoked bacon and it was pretty regular. Nothing amazing or special about it.   French toast was yummy, but again, pretty standard.   Cute pictures of piglets. Nice color-scheme. Coffee bar is plus. Screaming children was a negative...  The service was great. Good location.   Will probably back if I'm in the area.

Wowza!! We started by sharing the warm maple bacon donut holes which were so delicious. I had the pork confit eggs benedict, and son had bacon pancakes. And we couldn't pass on the flight of bacon. Ok...so we were stuffed, but it was well worth it!!

First off, the food was excellent. However, the service almost made me leave before I even ordered. Granted, I went in on a Sunday morning and it was busy. When I approached the hostess stand I asked how I could order takeout. Before the hostess answered we were interrupted by a man who was possibly the owner or manager. He sent her to take care of something and walked away also leaving me standing there by myself. So I next approached the register where a cashier appeared to be either cashing out an order or entering an order. The only greeting I received after standing there was when the server held up her finger as a gesture to tell me to wait but she said nothing. After I patiently waited for about two minutes I moved over to the counter and waited until the owner/mgr took my order. After giving my order I left for a few minutes to shop while my order cooked. When I returned it was difficult to find someone to help me pick up my order. There was a very nice, but busy lady helping at the counter. I overheard her say she was a school teacher helping the family out and she was kind and helpful. I had the biscuits and gravy which were great, my daughters ate up all of their bacon pancakes, and my husband enjoyed an omelette.   My family has lived in Phoenix for about 4 years and we have seen 3 restaurants open and close in that location since then. We are really hoping that the Oink Cafe is able to make something out of the location. I will probably return when things get settled because the food was good but if the service and apathy toward customers is a similar experience I won't likely give it a 2nd try.

Walked in and had to wait 5-6 minutes for acknowledgment from anyone.   After we asked if we could just take a table,  we waited what seemed another 5mins for menus.   We asked for coffee ASAP and sat another 8mins before just leaving.   The place was not busy and had tables open.   I don't think speed is a priority and from what we were able to gleam from the prices on the filthy menu, neither is value.   $3 for an egg and $2.50 for a slice of bacon? ... really?   No thanks.   We went to 5 & diner for half the cost and had coffees in hand within 4mins.

I have been here a couple of times already and have had two great breakfasts.  The wait staff is pleasant and upbeat.  We were seated right away and able to order in a matter of minutes.The food arrives fresh from the kitchen and reasonable portions.    The restaurant has been fully updated from its previous incarnations.  The price of the food is reasonable and the coffee is delicious.  Visit!

So unimpressed by this place and the menu. Considering the name I was expecting a great breakfast pork selection. Not so much. Pork chop I got was tough. My brother had pork sausage links I swear are the same frozen ones the lame breakfast chains use.   I won't be back. I would  give 2.5 stars if I could because our service was excellent on a very busy Saturday morning.

Eh. Food is bad quality cooked with to much butter or the eggs are just cheap not much taste service is decent staff are friendly and nice but sometimes over talkative when I'm trying to eat my food I've been there more than once I liked it the first time then slowly realized the quality of the food really sucks!

I seriously love this place.  The only thing that stinks is the french dip is off the menu.  But today I ordered a bbq sandwich.  BBQ sandwiches are tricky, you seriously have to get every bit right, juicy but not so much that my bread is like mush, pork with a strong enough flavor I can taste it through the sauce, and bread I can chew!  Well, they nailed it.  They also put the cole slaw on the side for me since I'm weirded out by cole slaw on a sandwich.  Oh, and I have mentioned the sweet potato fries....oh ya! They don't salt them so you will have to do so but that's ok because I can go either way with these tasty morsels :)  Did I say that I got all this while walking in 10 minutes before they closed and they were so sweet to me and didn't complain, at least while I was in earshot....thanks guys!

I've been here a handful of times and each time my experience has been average.  I primarily continue to come here because it's only a few blocks from my house and it's an easy place to meet clients for meetings. However, having said all of that, I highly doubt I'll be back after my experience this morning.  I arrived this morning to read the paper and relax.  I always order the huevos rancheros because it's always been good to me.  I've had clients who have ordered other items on the menu and have been very disappointed (I have had two friends order a dish that came with a biscuit--each time, the biscuits had the consistency of a rock).  Anyway, for whatever reason, I decided to live dangerously and order something else.  I ordered the egg white omelet with home fries and whole wheat toast.  It arrived and was nothing unique or off-the-charts.  But hey, it tasted good.  After I was done polishing that off, I still had a hankering (yeah, that's right--a hankering) for something else.  Considering how full I was, I needed something small.  I remembered seeing blueberry pancakes on the menu, so I asked my server how many came with a side order.  He told me a stack of two or four. I asked him if they were gigantic and he said no, they were typical pancakes.  I put in an order for two.  When they arrived they looked good, but like everything else here, were nothing special.  Imagine my surprise when I cut into the short stack and realized only one of them had blueberries in it.  Oh well, what the hell; I ate them both.  After many attempts to get a coffee refill (I was seated on the patio--if you like refills, don't sit there) I gave up and looked at the check.  (Side note: The servers here immediately give you the check after your food arrives.  Their reasoning is that they don't want you to have to wait for the check.  I don't buy it.  I feel rushed when they do this. In fact, they tell you "No rush" when they put it on the table, so clearly I'm not the only one that has wondered about this.)  The check was pretty straightforward, except for the charge related to my two blueberry pancakes (sans blueberries).  For some reason, my server accidentally charged me for the blueberry pancake meal, or so I thought, since he charged me $6.99 for the dish.  I asked about it, and guess what?  It was not a mistake.  This place has the audacity to charge $7 for TWO PANCAKES!!!  What the heck is in them that they cost $3.50 a piece?  Before I wrote this review, I called IHOP  (yes, IHOP--they're across the street from Oink, so they're competition and the food quality is comparable) and asked them how much their double blueberry pancake side costs.  A stack of two costs $3.79 and a stack of four costs $6.99.  Can you explain that to me?  Same size, same ingredients, same zip code, hell, the same street, but Oink charges DOUBLE!  Anyway, considering the outrageous prices, the average service (servers are nice, but not very quick with the refills, or anything else, except the check), and the average/slightly above average food, I feel like I can do better.  IHOP, here I come!

"Bippity Boppity Bacon". I wonder how Jim Gaffigan would feel about this cute 'lil joint?  When you walk in through the main entrance, you will notice the lovely patio and a walk up window (love it) where you can place a take-out order. Creative, but if you are going to wait for your order, I would recommend snagging one of the four seats at the inside counter where you can enjoy a coffee or espresso drink and salivate at the delicious-looking pastrie, some of which, are bacon flavored.  The walls are painted bright yellow, green, and orange, with fun wall art of various pigs. In addition to the four counter seats, there is plenty of seating between the green booths and tables, but if you have a party of five or larger, your only option is to push together the tables and sit in the uncomfortable looking wood chairs. Luckily, I was just there with my madre so we got to enjoy a comfy booth.  We were greeted and seated immediately by friendly staff and a few seconds later our waitress greeted us and took our drink orders. I ordered a latte that wasn't anything special (no latte art either), but hey, they don't advertise about their espresso, so no biggie. I opted for their half of sandwhich and soup or salad deal. I chose their BLT with applewood smoke bacon and a side salad, just so I don't clog up all my arteries. My mom went for the full BLT sandwhich with sweet potato fries. There area few bacon options to choose from like: applewood smoke, honey cured, sugar cured, peppered, and jalapeno bacon, but our server suggested to stay with the classic applewood smoked, so we listened. The sandwich was pretty tasty and they don't skimp on the yummy bacon, the side salad was boring and basic, but the sweet potato fries were delicious, good choice mom!  All in all, good service, decent food, reasonable prices. I would come back and try their bacon pancakes, which is what the server said they are known for, but I'm not in any rush. FYI: This place closes at 2pm everyday and isn't open at all on Tuesdays.

Great food is about all I got.  Service is some of worst I've ever seen.  10 customers on a weekday morning and 8 people I saw working.....almost a one to one ratio.  Waited for everything...drink order, food, drink refill, and check.  Simple things could be better....fresh butter.....fresh OJ.   Hope it gets better....will try again later.

My fiancé and I had breakfast here. Saw a lot of great reviews and it's usually busy.  I was very disappointed.  I started with the flight of bacon.. You get to try all their flavors of bacon. To my surprise, they all tasted the same.  Half of the strips of bacon were rock hard too.  I am a bacon fanatic like most true Americans, but man I was bummed!   I also had the biscuits and gravy.  That was pretty bland.  The gravy was cold, but at least the biscuit was fluffy.    I don't think I will be returning here, nor would i recommend it.

Jalapeño Bacon hell yea!!  Overall pretty good and will try again. Consistency on the poached eggs is a little off. Bacon also inconsistent some chewy others crisp and burnt. We did like the coffee, so glad more breakfast places have have raised the coffee standard.   Give this place a try.

This place is awesome! My boyfriend and I have been going there for the last 6 months and absolutely love it  we have never had a bad experience there. The food is amazing and I can't even talk about the bacon without my mouth watering! Anne the manager is so nice and always takes care of the customers! We had stepped away from the restaurant to go to the book store while we waited to get sat and when we came back they had already called our name. So when I asked them, they said they would seat us at the next avaliable table. I didn't expect them to do this for us but no more than that minutes later we were being sat! My boyfriend ordered the Oink omelet and I had the egg breakfast. It was so good! Can't rave more about this place and the staff! Such a great atmosphere!

Yum! I have been here a few times now and I have not been disappointed. The specialty coffees are great. I had a latte and it came out piping hot. I've had an omelet and the eggs Benedict and both were very good. Last time I was here I saw someone with an awesome looking Bloody Mary that had strips of bacon garnish which I will definitely try next time.
Good food.  Great service. The chicken strawberry salad is my favorite.
Was excited to eat here. Food was disgusting, too greasy, and service sucked. Would not recommend to anyone!

Their French Toast is Awesome , their bloody marry is Awesome, the California omelette is Great the homefries are actually a bit crunchy on the outside and soft on the inside which is in my opinion perfect. BUT ..... their ham steak is more like a ham strip and the staff could be more informed of the menu and what the ingredients are in each plate and maybe pay more attention when taking the order in the first place. Most of the girls are attentive to other table besides their own which was good in our case or we would've sat with half our meal eaten and empty glasses.  All in all I would love to come back if we happen to be in the are again, but without pork chops on the menu and the ham steak being so thin we may decide on another place for lunch. Thanks to the floor manager for being so attentive when her server wasn't.  I am giving 5 stars because one server and a long wait time shouldn't shame a business that has such an AWESOME COOK , and Staff that does care.
Definitly not I would come back! Love bacon and seevice was good! Nice server too! But my biscuit and gravy looked like vomit!

My normal breakfast joint was closed today, so I gave this restaurant a shot since it's close to home. I came in about three years ago but I can't really recall why I haven't been back.  For me, I could frame the experience around the home fries. I was looking forward to nice griddle finished home fries. You know the ones - soft potato with a crispy brown/black edge from the griddle top, with flavorful seasoning? Yeah, that's not what they do here. Instead you take cubed potatoes and throw them in the deep fryer, creating little square marbles that lack the texture and flavor of true home fries. Essentially, they are phoning in the effort on this part of the menu.  Service was friendly but ended on a sour note. I was her only customer yet it took five minutes to run my credit cards. Let's call it a minute to run the dirty dishes back to the dishroom, and then four minutes of chatting with a customer at the counter about cell phone plans.   With all of the great breakfast places nearby, including Joybus Diner and Perk, there's simply no reason to go back.

The food here is good, but the service has been great every time I've eaten here.  I'm not as big on their bacon, but they make great eggs and French toast :)  When looking for a nice place to meet a friend for breakfast or lunch, I've always enjoyed this café (and even though the patio outside is small, it's always good to be able to eat outside and enjoy the weather on a nice day).

If you love all things bacon this is your place! Just across from paradise valley mall in the a Target parking lot Oink has quickly become a favor for Sunday morning breakfast. It fills fast so get there early but even a wait is worth it. All the servers are good and your food comes out quickly. I've had the breakfast hash which is excellent. Omelettes are delicious and coffee good as well. Enjoy! Long live Bacon!!

I visited Oink for the first time today and I have to say the food was delicious and the service was great! I had an iced caramel latte, and the French toast combo with jalapeño bacon. The bacon was perfectly cooked and a little spicy! Some of the best bacon I've had. Great atmosphere, I highly recommend this place.

Based on the name and outside advertisements, you'd assume that this was some sort of pork style specialty house. Once inside you'd assume that it would smell like pork. You'd assume there would be pictures of swine everywhere. And you'd assume that not only will the menu be pork heavy, but that also the server would promote and encourage pork. So imagine my surprise when none of these things were true.  It wasn't a big deal though that it seems they were trying real hard to be a classy restaurant. But its an oink cafe. That means pig coffee to me. I want Bacon and an espresso. It should smell like Bacon and coffee. Or Bacon or coffee. It was more of a chemical smell.   The layout was odd too. There were apparently two entrances. What I thought was the front which is located street side might have been the back because when you walk in, its a weird long hallway type room filled with tables. (BTW it was packed) The other side had what looked like a main counter with a menu but we never got that far because this was a be seated by server place.  Decorations were odd too. There were SOME artsy pictures of swine. But mostly random pictures of art. I love art but it didn't fit.   Our server must have been a rookie. Not very attentive. She kind of just threw the crayons in front of my daughter. She didn't explain the menu at all. It took her forever to bring our drinks. And I even tried to break the ice by asking the standard "what would you get?" question. Her response, "I'm not really sure. I think everything's good."  Ok when I hear that I get annoyed. Humuor me at least. Also know you product and services. And if your going to promote a "classy" resturant, then don't wear short shorts. Nothing made sense. On to the menu:  Basically the menu is basic items like sanwhiches and salads that have one or two Bacon strips. Ok. Well I got the salad. And to my surprise it was pretty good.  It was a fresh spinach salad with an assortment of seeds and fruit and Bacon bits. Also they had a custom dressing called Bacon dressing. Now it tasted nothing like Bacon. It was more of a sweet vinagerette of sort. It was good. The salad though was amazing. it wasn't over filled with everything. It was mostly spinach. And again very fresh.   Salad was good enough to give a three star. Also it wasn't a bad experience, just dissapointing. And the only reason I factor in the poor server is because the owner himself was walking around greeting people and when he got to us, he wasn't really engaged or genuine. So perhaps a lack of customer service training could be the reason for our poor service.   If your in the area and you want a salad for lunch, I'd recommend them.

The oink café is great little breakfast joint if you've never been I would recommend giving it a try. So far I've had no issues with this spot. Food is good and servers all seem to be nice and friendly. The only minor complaints I might have is there seem to be a lot of fly's on the patio. More so than a normal patio where you would see the occasional fly. They really seem to be in abundance here. Also sometimes the food doesn't come out as hot as it should. Other than that I will still keep coming back,.

I was looking forward to try The Oink Cafe for a while, as we like to support our local businesses.  We got a coupon on the mail and went there for breakfast a couple of weeks ago. Our server Heather was nice, she was very patient as we had a mix up with the coupon and she helped us.  We liked the idea of flavored bacon, we tried the jalapeño and it was very tasty, however, they didn't pass the crispy bacon test... we always make sure to say 'very crispy'...  I ordered 'huevos rancheros' and didn't like them much... they had some sort of red enchilada sauce, which it would have been OK, but it was kind of sweet and I didn't like it.  Hubby ordered an omelette with chorizo an it was ok, it had the red sauce too.  Beans and potatoes were very good, I ended up making my own breakfast burrito at home with them : )  Oh, if you access through the Cactus entrance, make sure to go to the other door as the hostess is there... they do have a sign by the door but  I missed it...

The service was great and the ambience was good.  We didnt feel rushed and enjoyed our long breakfast/lunch.  The people were so nice not to rush us out, it wasn't until I noticed the open sign facing our way did we think to ask them what time they close.  Apparenlty, it was an hour past the point I noticed.  They let us hang out, even gave us a free brownie and chocolate chip cookie which was to live for!.  The owners are very nice.  I ordered half a club sandwich and tortilla soup with sweet potato fries.  The sandwich much bigger than my bite could handle but delish! My boyfriend had a huge breakfast burrito.  The portions are massive!!!! The only thing is that we were expecting more pork options..at least pork chop or pulled pork items on the menu. But, it is definitely a place we will go back to.

Best eggs benedict ever! Service is always great home fries are delicious bacon Bloody Marys are great as well. I have brought my family from out of town to the Oink and everyone loves it every time!  The manager Sean is always coming around to make sure all guests  are having a great experience!

Came here for breakfast over the weekend.  It was ok. We started with the flight of bacon.  I only really liked 2 of the flavors.  My husband enjoyed the spicier ones but I can't eat those.  The applewood was great though!  My breakfast was average - nothing special.  Service was average.  Overall, an ok experience.  I might come here again but wouldn't go out of my way for it.  I will say they had some pastries in a case by the front door... I didn't have the appetite left to try them but man did they look delicious!  Maybe next time!

American Breakfast Food With Good Service  We popped in here for a little brunch after visiting REI nearby... This place was super packed and I must say it was good food.   I had the chicken fried chicken with gravy and it was good...   The manager lady was super friendly and made sure she stopped by to make sure we were happy mid meal...   Not much else to say but if you need a good feeding this may just be your spot....

One of my favorite places to eat breakfast. They get very busy so be prepared for a bit of a wait. But half the time they over estimate your wait time. Great variety on the menu and always great service. However depending on who is working the patio it tends to get forgotten and sometimes there has been confusion on who is actually waiting on us. Management is on top of it and has always noticed before we waited too long but I have had to point out to them one time when they seated two ladies on the patio on a rather hot day and 10 minutes went by before they were even offered water. But they made up for it with very quick playing. The flight of bacon is my favorite!

Oink oink!!  That's what I was thinking as I saw the pigs on the walls, on the coffee mugs, and elsewhere around the Oink Cafe.  Not to mention the five different ways that bacon is prepared (applewood smoked, honey cured, sugar cured, peppered, jalapeno).  I found my experience very pleasant as I parked, sat down with no waiting late on a Saturday morning, and was greeting almost right away.  Don't get me wrong...there were still a lot of people in the restaurant, and it appeared that everyone was enjoying themselves.  The service was outstanding as my waitress was very pleasant and helpful and continued to stop by to check on my father and me.    The food itself was very good.  Both my father and I ordered traditional breakfasts (to keep it simple for our first time at the Oink Cafe).  He ordered applewood smoked bacon, extra crispy while I ordered honey cured bacon.  Both orders were delicious!  The rest of the breakfast resembled any other breakfast restaurant though the dishes were still good.  As an entire package (the food, service, wait, atmosphere), it was definitely worth the trip.  Plus, there are some coupons online for 15% off your bill, $1 off any gourmet drink, or a free maple bacon donut (at http://www.8coupons.com/discounts/the-oink-cafe-phoenix-85032).   Oh, and if you're not a fan of bacon, there are plenty of non-bacon breakfast and lunch dishes, too!
We live in Colorado but visit Oink every trip to Phoenix!!!! Their bacon (all flavors) is the bomb!
