Okay so I work across the street and have thought about this place every single time.  Finally, my husband being home on a weekend and no kids, we went.  I had the 1/2 flight of bacon.  It was good, not great.  My bacon was not cooked evenly (some pieces were barely done, and one piece was burnt).  It was good and I could distinguish the flavors.  The Strawberry Cheesecake pancakes were awesome though.  Service was great, friendly and courteous.  I would come back, but give specific directions on how to cook my bacon.

Sometimes, I feel cheated by salads at restaurants, because I figure, I could buy a bag of lettuce, dump it on a plate and call it a day for a third of the price! I had a really satisfying strawberry and chicken salad  ($8.99)  here recently and will definitely go back next time I'm in the market for a healthy lunch out: 4 ounces of grilled chicken on a generous heap of salad, topped with blue cheese and fresh strawberries.

Pretty standard breakfast fare, I'd say. So the prices might be too high for the type of food you'd expect.   I got the pulled pork benedict which was good. It was very tender but the sauce was pretty limiting.   Bf had omelette. It was the five egg omelette which was huge but it looked pretty sparse to me in toppings. We also has a bacon donut which is really crunchy but wasn't warmed or anything so that kind of fell flat. Way too sweet. Skip the syrup with it but it might be too dry otherwise.

The wife and I decided to visit this locale this morning because it is only about a 5 minute or less walk from our Apartment. I have read every review on here pertaining to this establishment and most of it remains true despite the fact it has been almost 2 weeks since it has been open. We arrived at about 11:00am and we were seated fairly quickly. The server came pretty quickly and got us some water and I had the coffee which is just average.   It took us about 5 to 7 minutes to decide what to order and the server took our order at about 11:15am. I ordered the Pancake Combo with one egg scrambled....and turkey sausage. My wife had the Chorizo and eggs which came with home fries. So after about 30 minutes waiting for our food to arrive.....the owner or manager....which was an elderly lady... came out to each table an apologized for the long wait and offered us some oink cookies. She explained that when they were planning the business structure that she was told there would be several customers in the area that would come to this type of establishment. However there have been hundreds of people showing up and they were not prepared for that.  She also expressed there have been some issues with the cooking staff....arguing back and forth about who should be preparing what....and how it should be prepared....there are some huge communication issues that need to be worked out. Finally at about 12:05pm we finally received our food....so that means it took about an hour from the time we first ordered. Now since we live so close to this establishment I didn't mind the wait.....however had I come say 20 minutes away....I wouldn't want to wait an hour to have breakfast.   The Food was OUTSTANDING.....DELICIOUS.....AWESOME.....so there were no problems in this area at all. Now if this establishment can just get better organized....because we had to ask for silverware.....napkins....straws....and butter for my pancakes.....and get the communication issues squared away in the kitchen....this will be a guaranteed 5 star establishment. So by all means if your in the east valley and are looking for a place to have a GREAT TASTING....MADE TO ORDER breakfast....give the Oink Cafe a try. Eat, Drink, and be Merry my Friends!!!!  NOTE: Just another FYI the elderly lady came back after we finished our breakfast and offered us a wonder piece of sour creme pecan coffee cake....so she was really trying to make customers feel comfortable and apologize for our wait. You have to appreciate that kind of service and her honesty about the situation....I truly believe this place will have great success once they fix some of there issues!!!!
Tasty food and a good assortment of mimosas! Wish they had a mimosa special though. I need to come again to try out the flight of bacon!

I really wanted to love this place and the concept is a great one but it didn't live up to its potential. The service here was sub par, it was really busy and a little longer wait is fine. Our waitress never returned to fill our drinks, never checked to see if we needed anything and had to be flagged down in order to get our check. Like I said they were busy and I'll gladly make exceptions for that but being completely ignored is unacceptable to me.   The food was only ok as well. We ordered a flight of bacon, which is supposed to be the backbone of the menu. All of the samples were good but none of them were great. In most cases I wouldn't be able to distinguish it from store bought bacon, with the peppered bacon as the exception.   Both of our breakfast items were ok, a little on the bland side. Nothing worth complaining about or sending back but also nothing that would make me come running back. Overall it reminded me of a small town greasy spoon diner that was trying desperately to be a trendy uptown bistro.

Food here is fantastic, service needs a lot of help.  From the hostess who doesn't have control to servers who aren't managing their tables.  That said, if you are looking for good food and have an hour or so for breakfast or lunch, this is a don't miss in the east valley.  The bonus is patio seating.  Just bring your patience.

I've been going here for breakfast since they opened. Everything I've had has been really good. My favorites are the biscuits and gravy, PV omelet  with egg whites, Oink Waffle. The cafe mocha is awesome too. The service has always been friendly and fast.

How is it that I've never reviewed this place before? As many times as I go, I would have thought I'd done Oink.   Oink is not to be missed. It is a great and funky little breakfast joint that specializes in one thing... Can you guess? BACON!   Ok, let's make this clear - everything they make us good. They would be a success even with out the bacon. And the service is great. Some of the employees have been there for years. When you meet them you will understand. They love this place too. I like to see that level of investment.   But the BACON - that stuff is crazy good. They do "Bacon Flights" where you get to see and taste all different kinds of bacon. And I still can't pick a favorite.
The service impeccable; spot on, friendly, quick, that alone is worth the trip. Now add the food! Even the decor! Will be a frequent flyer.

I went here for the first time on Father's Day and had a wonderful experience! The waitress had a bright and welcoming personality, the coffee was fresh, my breakfast was kept simple, though flavorful...everything was lovely! I really enjoy the fact they offer gluten free items because it's a real pain finding restaurants that have those options! The waitress was helpful in catering to my food allergy needs with patience and I greatly appreciated that. I definitely recommend stopping in for breakfast if you're ever in the area!

This is my favorite breakfast joint - we live 10 miles away but this is always where we go.  Oink Café French Toast is my favorite.  They also have a plate of 8 kinds of bacon which my husband loves.  I have not had anything here that I have not liked, I do want to try more items but always crave the French toast when I walk in, the sweet potato fries are also great - sometimes I get a side with my French Toast.  They are only open for breakfast and lunch which is a downside for me as I would have no problem going more than once in a day.  The hostess on the weekend, a young girl is pretty slow but the food is beyond worth it.  I have recommended this place to everyone I know.

Food is awesome... Service was really bad and that was disappointing.  We didn't even get our coffee or waters until the food arrived.  I had an omelet and it was great.  My kids love the pigs in a blanket.  Only concern was 10 minutes to be greeted and 20 for our drinks!?!
The Oink is my family's favorite restaurant.  The staff is friendly and the food is great.  It's our version of "Cheers"....everyone knows our name when we walk through the door!

We felt that the yelp reviews underrated this place. Been three times now. Service is a little slow because they're very busy. The food is good! Lots of bacon everything including different flavors of bacon. We like the applewood the best. Go Eat Here!

I really enjoy going to the Oink Cafe for breakfast. They have a few dishes that I really like, especially the Arizona Omelette. That one is a little spicy and really good. The service is usually really good, sometimes a little slow if they're really busy. But that's to be expected anywhere you go. After some recent disappointments with other breakfast places, finally a restaurant where everything is just right. Keep it up, I'll be back for more.

All around amazing food and great staff!! I highly recommend the French toast and Californian omelet! My other favorite is a breakfast appetizer which is the bacon flight! Before you leave you have to get yourself a maple bacon doughnut, so good!  My go to breakfast joint every weekend!:)

Maybe a busy Saturday morning is not The Oink Cafe at its best...but then it should be at its best on a busy Saturday. Yes, they have 8 varieties of bacon. Mine was no bigger or better than the bacon I had earlier in the week at Wendy's. The potatoes were dry and tasted like frozen from the bag. Coffee was good. One of my guests ordered a Bloody Mary--I couldn't help but notice that she only drank half, too polite to say anything negative. Waitress was friendly.

For a business that is all about their bacon, it is rather disappointing!  The atmosphere is great and fun.  The service was decent, it was moderately busy, but the waitresses seemed overworked and not very enthusiastic.  But the bacon is what I had a problem with most!!  The signs all around the business talk about bacon and how they have 8 different flavors to try.  So, I ordered a full flight of bacon, one piece of all 8 flavors.  To say it was impressive would be a lie.  Most of the flavors tasted very similar, while a couple of them had no taste at all.  I did like the flavors of the Jalapeño and Apple Cider bacon, but the rest were rather "run of the mill".  The biggest turn-off was the size of the bacon, it was so small and not worth the value!  For an 8-piece plate, it costs $8.99!  That's over $1 a slice and they were so small!  I was expecting some thick cuts of bacon, something that would be a mouthful and give you a full sense of their quality food, but it was rather the opposite.  I don't think I will be going back there again.  For the same price, I could have ordered an entire meal, instead what I got was a medium-sized snack.

This place is amazing! Service was on point and you made my bacon loving fiancée very happy. We can't say enough about Oink, except we will see you again next weekend.. And the week after that and the following .. Etc!

First time here....we live within 5 minutes but have waited to visit to allow them some time to work out the initial kinks of a new restaurant based on previous Yelp reviews.  We got there around 10:00'ish on a Sunday morning.  We were seated right away and got our drinks right away.  Restaurant did not seem overly busy to me. We had some questions about the menu, got them answered and placed our order.  We ordered the Paradise Valley Omelette and the Steak and Eggs.  It took 27 minutes for them to deliver our first entree'. The omelette was hot off the press, steaming and had some really nice hot, stringy cheese.  The Steak and Eggs was a completely different story.  The steak was cold, overcooked and tough.  Enough said so I sent it back. My next entree' (Eggs Benedict) came out in 5 minutes and it looked great.  However, the English Muffin was barely toasted, the ham was super thin, and the Hollandaise was tasty but it basically formed a pool on the plate.  There were some positives.  We ordered a side of the Jalepeno Bacon and it was really good.  I had the side of Biscuits and Gravy on the Steak and Eggs entree and the biscuits were good.  You could tell they were homemade.  Also, the homemade sausage gravy was great.  Our waitress was really great and really seemed to know the menu well.  She did comp the Eggs Benedict entree after we talked about how weak the Steak and Eggs came out from the kitchen.  The food runner needed some help in a big way....I just kept seeing him flash in and out of the kitchen and running through the dining room.   The bakery items looked really good so I might go back to try them sometime in the future.   Overall, I'd say about 2.5 stars but I've definitely had better breakfasts at other restaurants in the area.  I'm not completely convinced that I'd go back unless I knew it was going to be a better overall experience.

Good breakfast items but the bacon is clearly the star in this place.  I love jalapeno bacon and this place does it up right.  The flight of bacon is a great idea.  Maple and bacon donuts?  Heck yeah.

Slightly above average breakfast joint with a few distinctive items.  The servings are more generous than average and service is good.  They have a full bar and of course you have to try the bacon bloody mary!  Would definitely eat here again.

OMG- I LOVE Oink. And I hate breakfast restaurants. So I guess that says a lot.   Tried it out on a whim one day and now I crave it- they have the BEST french toast. My husband rotates between pigs in a blanket and bacon pancakes. I initially was skeptical, especially after reading reviews. But, it's right across the street from an IHOP so I figured that they probably had something unique going on if they have been able to keep their lights on.   Once we decided to go in there and give Oink a try, I knew that we'd make a good choice. The pastry case with the bacon-maple donuts caught my attention, and It kept getting better- we received excellent service and ate excellent food. I'm really not sure why there aren't more 5 star reviews. One of these days, I'm going to have to be bad and get one of those donuts. Their pastry case seriously looks amazing, if you're trying to become a diabetic at breakfast.   We travel with a 1-year-old, so eating out is hard. Oink is the perfect place for us to go grab breakfast because it's noisy (read, always full), so I don't worry about my loud and messy baby, and it's fast (we have never been there more than 45 minutes from beginning to end.) It's always busy when we're there, but not too busy- longest wait I've had has been 5 minutes. We've gone there a handful of times since the first, and have never had the bad service people talk about, but maybe that's because we go early, closer to 8 (and we miss the after church crowd.) If you go in the winter months, be sure to sit on the patio- not much to look at (in the Target parking lot) but much more quiet.

I come to Oink often and always wonder why.  The good is great but today is a great example of 1 star.  The back of the house is great but the front of the house is horrible.  I get weekends are busy. I've been in Scottsdale / Paradise Valley long enough to understand weekend wait times.  Here's the deal today.  Waited twenty minutes so far for a table with a lot of other people. As I stand here, there are NINE unoccupied, unbussed tables including FOUR that needed bussing when we arrived here twenty minutes ago.  Many others in town I won't name handle a far greater Sat/Sun load without issue.  I really want to like Oink but the front end mismanagement is terrible.  I've watched five parties walk away while we've been waiting. I'll go somewhere else from now on.

My girl friend was talking about going here. So we decided to make it a choice after a 5K marathon.  Hungry and tired we decided to stop my Oink.... they bragged about having 8 different types of bacon.   So let's see....  As we walked in  there was a cute waitress who made  sure to tell us there is a 20 mins wait....  not bad on a brunch Sunday!   We finally got seated and I grabbed the menu.  Let's see... I need a cup of coffee first....  now let's order.    I decided to get the classic home fries, eggs and their famous peppered bacon. Of course I ordered the butter milk biscuit.  The price was great.... that plate was $7.99. Perfect price if you have a large family.   I turned to see the waitress heading towards me with a tray full of goodness. As she placed the plate in front of me. I was completely DISAPPOINTED the bacon was so thin and  wilted.  I imagined thick slices of pepper dipped bacon....   SORRY.... I received the saddest looking bacon in all of bacon land. Let's not start on the home fries which were hard and burnt.   I moved all of my food around to make it look like I ate something.  I was so hungry I just had to eat it.  As tears were welling up in my eyes.  I began to eat the worse breakfast I have had in about a year.  Look advertising bacon should mean I'm in bacon heaven not BACON HELL....   I wouldn't return for there breakfast maybe their sandwiches are better but I don't think I would try that either.    Walking down disappointed lane!

BACON...need I say more?? i enjoy the smell of the bacon as it makes it's way into the air and over to where I live. I love coming here for breakfast and lunch. All the gals there are friendly and the service is good. In fact today when I mentioned to the owner's brother that I had not tried the apple cider (it was jalapeno for me today) he went and got me some to try - that's treating the customer right!

Worst breakfast experience of my life. I come from the restaurant industry and usually cut people a good deal of slack. After my breakfast being prepared incorrectly 4 times the owner refused to apologize and said that my breakfast only went back to the kitchen twice. I will not be going back.
Great management here. Everyone is so friendly and welcoming, waitresses hostesses and even the managers. Love it! Yummy food too!!!

It was the last meet up for the Breakfast Club UYE for the year and Oink Café was the place that was picked!  I'm not a big pork eating fool, but I love me some BACON!!! How can you not love BACON! It's the best thing on the planet! So I was pretty stoked to be headed to Oink.  I do have to say they make a mean up cup of coffee, I drink my coffee black unless its whack then I doc it up, but Oink's was perfectly great straight up black!   I ordered the bacon stuffed pancake with a side of bacon, I had been picturing thick slices of apple wood smoked bacon ( I don't know why it was apple wood smoked in my head, but it just was) and I couldn't wait to get my teeth into it! What I got was a slice on the thin side, it was cooked the way like, not too crispy, not too soft, just wasn't what I was expecting. But the bacon stuffed pancakes OOOMMMMGGGG!!! Every bite was loaded with bacon, it was SWEET BLISS!! Maple syrup drenched pancakes loaded with salty pieces of bacon; it was heaven, pure heaven! All pancakes should be that way! haha  I also ordered a dozen bacon donut holes for my son, who is a bacon lovin fool too.  I enjoyed my breakfast and look forward to coming back for some more of them bacon stuffed pancakes!

This place used to be packed. But now with all the new breakfast joints popping up in the same area  I can understand why it's dead on a Thursday morning. Food is mediocre at best. Reminds me of an old truck stop diner. The bacon is good though I will give them that. But was REALLY pissed me off was not telling me of the actual up charge to add an item to your order. $3 for 4 thin slices of tomato?? I mean c'mon. **It's deceptive to not disclose the actual cost of the up charge!

Went on a sun morning. Short wait before being seated. Fun atmosphere and theme. Expected more bacon or pork themed items. Ordered chicken fried steak based on another review here. Very good, Highly recommend! Finished with a maple/bacon doughnut, pretty good. Will return

Have been here twice now for breakfast. I've had the blueberry pancakes and huevos rancheros. I love all of their different options for bacon. My favorites are the jalepeno and the apple cider! Friendly staff, good food, and fast service. All in all a good experience! I will be returning!

Love the bacon varieties; jalapeño is my favorite! Waffles are wonderful. House potatoes are grand. Service is prompt, polite and servers don't interrupt your conversation to ask if you need anything else!
Extremely rude host staff.  Very surprised at the way I was spoken to.  Food was average,  not a place I would visit again.

Yum! This brunch joint is a good spot to have tasty breakfast or lunch with a tasty bloody. They have a spicy tai bloody that is absolutely delicious. The coffee is very good, and I don't like to drink coffee a lot... the food is fair portioned and they have a large breakfast menu to pick from. I love coming here.

The Oink omelette and bacon glazed doughnuts are really good. Service is top notch.  A bonus is that the owner has experience with peanut allergies and is really conscious of avoiding peanuts in his restaurant.  I have a family member that is allergic to peanuts so the owner's assurances are a bonus.

We love Oink! Sunday breakfast is always great here. We hate to wait to be seated but who doesn't.  You know it's good, that's why you wait. Usually only 15/20 mins. Food is always yummy and the kids enjoy the food too. Ok to take the toddler also, who looooves their maple bacon donut holes! Lol...

First and last time here... hostesses were rude. Especially the elderly woman who was presumably supervising was rude,  and although Sundays are understandably busy, I don't think she should let her frustrations translate through to her guests.  We were quoted us the wrong wait time of 25 min after 39min when we asked were advised of would be another 35 min in a very abrasive manner.  We left and we won't find out if the food was worth the wait because of the rudeness of the host staff.  When spending $ service is almost as important as the food
The food is great here but the hostesses tend to underestimate the wait time. That wouldn't be so bad if the air condition temp was set lower. It feels like a sauna while you wait.

Excellent breakfast, and the jalapeno bacon is awesome!! I go there every chance I get, which unfortunately, is not often enough!  I haven't tried lunch there yet, but I'm sure it would be great as well!

Pros: Good amount of choices for menu options, including a full coffee service menu.  Staff was friendly.  Food was good - I had the waffle combo.   Cons: Noisy and a little on top of each other as far as table space.  There was a wait and no real place to stand and wait other than outside.  A touch overpriced for breakfast food, making them a bit less competitive for the surrounding area.  Overall: B+  Not the best breakfast place we have been to in Phoenix, but most certainly not the worst.  We'll be back for the bacon flight!

We came specifically for the lattes and bacon because I love bacon and hubby loves lattes. We go there on a weekday morning and surprisingly, they were pretty busy. We were told to seat ourselves and so once we did, it took some time to be greeted  by our server.   I ordered a hot hazelnut latte and hubby ordered an iced vanilla latte. The server dropped off two hot lattes and so I told him one was iced. The hazelnut latte was okay but the vanilla latte was pretty good. We decided to share the Paradise Valley omelet (spinach, mushrooms, bacon and cheddar cheese). The omelet came with hash browns and wheat toast. Then, we ordered 1/2 bacon flight: apple cider, applewood smoked, jalapeño and hickory.   Between the both of us, the omelet entree portion was generous and we couldn't even finish. The omelet was really good- big slices of mushrooms and lots of cheese! I think the whole bacon flight thing is a little overrated. The jalapeño bacon and applewood smoked was good, but $4.99 for four slices and they weren't even crunchy?! Maybe they should add the bacon to an entree or something instead and then you choose which ones you want.   Our server was pretty slow in getting us our check and checking us out, but our bill was inexpensive and we really enjoyed our meal and lattes.

Came here for breakfast and ordered the flight of bacon and the signature oink french toast. The french toast was very good and I would order it again. The bacon on the other hand was nothing to brag about. The flavors were very subtle and it wasn't crispy enough in my opinion.  I would come here again to try some of the other dishes but I'll probably get the sausage.

Had a few good meals there, but I had to update my review though from 4 stars to 2, we won't be back. We sat there for over 30 minutes with no food, people that arrived after us were eating and the waitress only acknowledged that our food wasn't ready yet, but it was obvious we were forgotten about.  Since we only had waters and no one was around for us to ask about the status of the meal we just left. Hungry and frustrated with wasting 45 minutes we will have to find a new breakfast place. I work in a restaurant and i know that stuff happens, some communication could have made a world of difference.

So the server started off with a positive bang. She was friendly etc...we ordered the omelette w bacon spinach cheese ok. The hashbrowns were frozen type small tiny portion cold and over done. I had the oink french toast. Nice could not taste the cornflake crunch. Because it was over cooked. One strawberry cut into tiny pieces and you get 5 blueberries on top. Two dried up pieces of bacon. Oink is the name of the place. Bacon lost me there. Finally we had a coupon from the entertainment book she says oh you got a bargain today. Lady don't count my money. It was our first time there we wanted to use our book. They should not say the food is homemade when you know they are not. Oh well you eat and learn....

We love Oink! The breakfasts are hearty and affordable and their coffee bar is amazing (try the mocha! Iced or hot!!) the bacon is the gimmick that gets you in the door but you stay for the great service and delicious food. It's definitely a restaurant I wish I could visit more often!

This was a last minute lunch decision as we were passing by. We were a bit late to the game since they closed at 2 and it was 1:45. Regardless of the time, they were quick to welcome us and get us seated. For it being almost closing time, they were still quite busy.  My husband and I both ordered the oink signature bloody mary. The flavor was very good and it came with olives and bacon. I decided on breakfast and went pretty simple with the eggs, hash browns, and jalapeño bacon. The bacon...oh the bacon...was absolutely delicious. The rest of the breakfast was good but the big standout here was the jalapeño bacon.  My husband got the chicken avocado sandwich and said it was amazing. It came with coleslaw which he also said was very good.   We will absolutely come back for the Bloody Mary, mimosa, and bacon flight!
What happened? This place was so great a couple years ago.. now the staff leaves something to be desired... Still like the food, hope staff gets a rearrangement.

We were excited to try this place out after seeing the reviews. Specializing in bacon? How can anything be wrong with that? We walked in on a Friday morning, around 10 am, and 90's rap was blaring through the empty restaurant. I mean LOUD. So, a little strange, but no big deal, we decided to sit outside. We looked at the menu and decided. I ordered the PV omelet and my husband chose the Belgian waffles. The food came out quickly and everything was really good. As we sat outside, we noticed broken glass at our feet. When the server came over to check on us, we told her about the glass, and she told us that it had been there since the previous morning. This made me a bit nervous--I worked at a corporate restaurant for many years and broken glass was like a 5 alarm fire. Also, I am very pregnant, so the glass at my sandaled feet made my husband nervous. After we told the server about the glass, she sent a kitchen guy out with a broom, but he swept the other side of the patio, no where near the glass. She said he would clean up the glass once we left, but then quickly sat the table next to us, also surrounded by glass. This in not a huge deal, but oversights such as this at a new restaurant make me a bit nervous about what else might be overlooked.  The food and service was good, and we may return.

We have been wanting to come here for quite some time now! So with us being able to squeeze in a Sunday brunch, we were finally able to come here. The wait was long and I believe we were quoted 20 minutes but I believe it was closer to 30 minutes. Once seated we were taken very good care of by our waitress. And, with that said that is my biggest complaint! If you have read any of my reviews in the past then you know I don't like to waste calories on bad food. Lucky for me this was a winning meal all around. Unbutton your top button on your pants and enjoy the ride. Eat like a pig if you want! You only live once! With that in mind, we went full fledge into the menu! We ordered the 10 piece bacon flight that featured 10 different bacon slices. Ok, we shared it! My absolute favorites were the Jalapeno, apple cider and the pecan wood slices. Hubby was a fan of the hickory. Pass the bacon, please! I also ordered the raspberry latte which was quite tasty. On to the main course: Hubby ordered the Oink Omelet with potatoes and toast. The omelet was a great size and quite enjoyable, although I wasn't given a bite I can attest to his enjoyment of it. I ordered the biscuits and gravy because that is something I would never make at home. It was without a doubt the best I've ever had and a great size portion. I loved the freshness of the biscuits! No salt or pepper needed.The potatoes were wonderful as well. Neither of us was able to complete our meal! That usually doesn't happen at breakfast. The bill was over $45 so it was a definite splurge in every sense of the word, but for the portion size and quality of the food, I feel it was worth it. The biggest thing they could improve on is wait time and opening up the patio area to diners who might not mind sitting outside in our AZ heat.

Walked in and instantly loved this spot. Was clean and yummy goodies. #Baconlover all welcome. :) Came around 930am on a Sun day and their were pretty busy inside and outside. Ordered espresso and goodies, will come back for breakfast as soon as possible. Decorations were layed out nice and staff was friendly.
My favorite local huevos rancheros! My family likes the chicken fried steak. Coffee is excellent. Get there before 9am on weekend or you'll wait 45 minutes.

This is where you go to get yer pig on, I'm talking bacon mania.  A wide variety of delicious breakfast plates, most of which feature that crispy delight, will satisfy ANY appetite. This place proves the old adage that 'bacon makes everything better'.

For one the service here was piss poor. There was no hostess at the front and when we did get seated they didn't explain they serve both breakfast and lunch at the time (we thought it was only lunch until we overheard other ppl ordering breakfast after we had ordered). The booth was squished together where we got sat at. Then the server took forever to come over, when she did she apologized and gave this lengthy story about not knowing who was cut (I don't care). There was 2 servers, one was in training (I'm assuming) and this wasn't explained either. The server never got my drink refill and also managed to screw up my order. The flight of bacon all tasted the same for the most part and their tomato soup wasn't great (how do you screw up tomato soup)? I will not be going back here-I've had better bacon and food elsewhere and service was pretty bad.

Kitschy name, cute concept, a little indie place in an area consumed by monolithic chains -- Oink really had all the potential in the world.   The space is simple, open, and clean, although very sparse --  what some may interpret as modern simply reeked of half-assedness to me. "Hey, let's throw some pink paint on one wall and call it a day!" The bathrooms had fancy schmancy modern sinks and fixtures, although the weekly cleaning form on the back of the door was, disconcertingly, completely blank.  The service was super average, better than I expected considering I had heard it was atrocious. My breakfast-loving SO and I did our usual, each of us getting our own separate egg things followed by a shared short stack of blueberry pancakes. My omelet was nice, steaming hot and full of nice fresh veggies. The home fries on the side, though, were cold. The English muffin was barely toasted, also cold, and so slathered in butter it was slippery. My SO inhaled most of his Hollandaise-slathered Benedict, but let's face it, he'd slurp down a dog turd if it was drenched in Hollandaise. The pancakes were completely and utterly unremarkable, as was the OJ (watery and bitter) and coffee.   The sucker punch was the bill: with tip, over $40 for two for breakfast. If I wanted to shell out $40 for breakfast, I would stay in my own hood and go to Taylor's where I know the food will be spectacular and the service top-notch. Alternatively, I could go to IHOP across the street, where I know the food will be reliably above average for half the price.  Sorry, Oink, your prices make you little piggies. You've gotta step up your game, because no one wants to pay Paradise Valley prices for a Glendale experience.

I have been wanting to come here for the longest time and this morning we had such an awesome experience here. The cafe is designed so cute and the staff is all smiles! We were sat right away, the waiter was very attentive and friendly. The mimosa's were delicious and strong. :) We ordered biscuits and gravy which were phenomenal and a side of french toast to share which was also delicious. You get a big portion and the food quality was great. Thank you too Sean for stopping by our table to make us laugh and make small talk, he was so nice! I definitely recommend this breakfast spot and I will be back! You won't leave hungry.

Well we could hardly wait to try this place that promised all these kinds of bacon and new flavors. Well we went the place was packed we ordered two different plates with two flavors of bacon on them.  Well we could not discern any difference in flavor. In fact both were near flavorless. It appeared the bacon had been in the deep fryer. The eggs were overlooked as well.   All in all passable and we will pass it up.  If you are in a hurry it is ok. But if not head to BoBo's
Oink how we love you. Let us count the way... 1. Bacon. 2. More bacon. 3. A great place to dine with your furry family members. I usually meet here with friends and family twice a month.

I'm really not the type to want to go out for breakfast, I'd rather save my dining money for lunch or dinner because I figure I can usually make just as good of a breakfast at home.  However, there is no way I could match their french toast, it is just outstanding.  We have been twice and I ordered that both times.  The first time, I told the waitress to put the berry sauce on the side because I usually don't like fruit toppings, they are too sweet and fake tasting.   But this sauce is delicious! It is homemade and very natural tasting, I ate every bit of it.  We also loved the jalepeno bacon.  My kids loved the pigs in a blanket.  We had very nice service both times, we will definitely be back!

bacon, bacon, and more bacon!  If you're a fan of bacon, and love breakfasty/lunchy places, then this place is for you. The menu is chock full of all your breakfast favorites. One of us got the eggs benedict with applewood smoked bacon. It was very good, with the eggs poached flawlessly.  Another got a lunch sandwich... Turkey, lettuce, tomato, and of course, bacon! apple cider bacon to be precise. The turkey was real roast turkey, not the slimy deli stuff.  I'm definitely a fan and will certainly return!

Was in the area and hungry, so I we decided to give this place a try.   This location is at the corner of Cactus and Paradise Valley Parkway in a shopping center with Target and REI. Parking is shared with all the businesses in the shopping center, but there is plenty of parking spaces to accommodate all the customers in the area.   From the outside, this place appears to be much larger then it actually is. When we got inside, it was very busy and almost every table was occupied. Asked the hostess how long the wait would be and she was able to seat us immediately. Note, this place is only open till 2 pm and we got there at 1 and it didn't die down any within the hour we were there. Not sure if they actually stay open past that though, as people were still coming in 5 minutes before closing time.   Once seated, we only had to wait about 5 minutes before our waitress came by and took our order. Both of us just got water, so she was able to bring it to us immediately. However, our food order took about 15-20 minutes to come out. I ordered the Roasted Turkey Sandwich ($10.49) which is a double decker of house roasted turkey, lettuce, tomato, and mayo on rye bread and came with a side of fries. I was very disappointed with the sandwich! Bread was good and toasted perfectly, but the turkey was dry and had no flavor. Lettuce was wilted and little to no mayo on the bread. Fries were tasty, but were not crispy at all. Definitely wouldn't order this item again. My date ordered the Ranchero Chimichanga ($11.49), which is filled with Pork confit, ranchero beans, home fries, and cheddar cheese rolled up in a flour tortilla and fried crispy. Topped with chorizo cheese sauce and served with your choice of side. He got the fries. He said it was very tasty and would get it again. However, the size is very large, so he was so stuffed after eating the Chimichanga, that he wasn't able to even touch the fries.   Our waitress came by only once to check to see if we needed anything else and to give us our check. It was a good thing we didn't need anything, as she was very busy with half of the tables and people always asking for more stuff. Even though she was very busy, she always greeted her customers with a smile. I could tell she was tired, but still she worked as hard and as efficiently as possible.  Tables were immediately cleaned off and set up for the next customers to be seated, floors also were constantly swept. However, the ladies bathroom was another story. Trash was overflowing on to the floor and it needed to be swept and mopped as there was water all over the floor! Toilet paper also needed to be refilled.   Probably would come here again, but maybe as a last resort. Just not really my type of food.

A flight of bacon???? Whoever came up with that is a genius! I LOVE this place! I swear whoever came up with this chain had a bacon loving person like me in mind. I had the regular bacon along with the hickory smoked flavor bacon. Both were great. My boyfriend tried the jalepeno bacon as well. We were definitely happy with our selections and are looking forward to going back. It was busy, as most great places are. Expect a little wait, but I guarantee it is worth it!

I absolutely love bacon so I had the try the different types they offer here. I got the biscuit breakfast sandwich with hash browns and the half flight of bacon with applewood smoked, apple cider, sugar, honey, and hickory. Given that this is a bacon place, you expect it to be a bit of a greasy spoon, but this was way over the top. The hashbrowns were dripping in grease and were a little flat. My biscuit was tasteless unless you count baking powder as a flavour, Pillsbury from a can would be a better option. The bacon was good but inconsistent in how it was cooked - some pieces were overdone and some were under and fatty. I liked all the different flavours but honey and applewood smoked were my favourites. I liked the pig serving plate and that we were given a guide to which pieces were which flavour. The coffee was good, which was a nice surprise, and service was very fast and friendly. Overall, a fun place to try but I couldn't make it my go-to without a bit of improvement from the kitchen.

I needed a quick place to stop for coffee before a work obligation and saw Oink from the street. Always looking to throw money anywhere but Starbucks, I made both a sharp turn and new enemies in traffic to get my ass there.   No wait to be seated, I took a seat out on the shaded patio and grabbed a maple bacon donut and a latte. Donut was warm and covered with a Ron Swanson worthy amount of the crispy bacon. Latte was yummy!  They showed me a menu and it all escalated so quickly ... suddenly I found myself in front of eggs, home fries, and two strips of the monthly special, Pecanwood Glazed Bacon.  I would put a baby in that bacon. I'd make an honest woman out of that bacon. You get the idea.   Order your home fries extra hot as tiny potatoes don't insulate themselves very well. The food was awesome and the service was CRAZY FRIENDLY: warm, but without the zeal of a used car salesman.  Eat here! Get bacon!

My husband and I have eaten at Oink Cafe twice. First time was the week they opened, early on a Thursday morning. Food was good, service was fine, but there was only one other customer besides us. Today we went there at 7:30 on Saturday, the place was almost empty when we got there but quickly filled up. First off, they were out of their homemade turkey sausage, that I wanted to try. I changed my order to Huevos Rancheros, and was really disappointed. The eggs were fine, but the beans were greasy, I could see a layer of lard floating on top of them. At $8.99 I thought it was really over priced. My husband had the pancake combo with bacon, he thought the bacon was over cooked, and the pancakes were almost raw, they were gummy and severly undercooked. As for service, our coffee was never refilled, once our food was dropped off we were completely ignored until the check was left. Customers around us were complaining, the woman behind us had to order her tea 3 times before it arrived, the man behind us complained that his order was wrong, many customers seemed unhappy with the wait and the service. I was really disappointed, I realize that they have only been open a couple of weeks, so we might return in a few months, if they survive that long. It's really too bad, I like small, locally owned restaurants, but the experience today was so bad that I'm not in any hurry to return. They got 2 stars, because our first visit was fine.
My kids say this is the happiest place on earth! I'll have to admit its awesome. No better place to have the best breakfast in PV!!

I don't know if I'd go back. The last time we were there they told us the wait would be 20 minutes and we wait 55 minutes. I timed it because it was so, so long. They did a good job on compensating us for it but it was still really unfortunate. We've been other times and the food is just ok each time.

I like the place but can't say it's anything to write home about as a breakfast joint. I will say the Mac n cheese is amazing though. I like that they have different bacon flavors, but for a place that focuses on bacon it seems low quality. I was expecting thick and yummy, just seems skinny and meh.

Had a breakfast meeting here once and never decided to go back. Service was great but the food wasn't worth it. The eggs felt like it was made out of a microwave and the gravy just wasn't to my standards. Let's just say I wont be trying this place again.
On Sundays, get here early. Food is good. Staff is very nice and friendly.

We've been wanting to try The Oink for a while now.  We meet some friends there for breakfast.  We were all disappointed. Service was terrible, we had to ask for coffee several times, the coffee had no taste. One person ordered a waffle and when it was served it was so cold the butter wouldn't even melt, we had to send it back. The food took a long time to be served. The waitress was polite but looked unkept about her appearance.  I don't think a person waiting on you should be wearing a sweatshirt.  What happened to looking good at your job no matter what it is.  It would be nice having a person serving your food to look presentable. All five of us decided we will not be returning to this restaurant.

First time here...love their motto..."Breakfast, Lunch and Bacon". Visited with my boyfriend and his 2 children. Enjoyed the food a lot. Had breakfast of an omlette filled with spinich, red and green bell peppers and turkey sausage. It was quite yummy.  Also tried their maple glazed bacon doughnut....talk about sinful! It was so wonderful. They had run out, but had made more just for us. That was worth the wait.  Service was pretty good with just a few mess  ups....but when I asked for a special order it was granted without fuss. Overall it was a good experience and I will go again.

Great food and fabulous service!  Wonderful dog friendly patio and all of the wait staff including the manager came out to say hello to the dogs.  They make a great Chai Tea. They have something on the menu for everyone.  Good location and nice atmosphere.

Visited on a Sunday Morning and it was busy. 25 minute wait. Service was ok as was the food. Strip mall atmosphere and Perkins food quality. The place is busy so it is a good value, just nothing special about it.
Good breakfast place. Open, bright space with friendly staff. Good healthy choice omelette and wonderful biscuits and gravy.

We came here for a late breakfast and it was great! The blood mary was AMAZING and you HAVE to order the Bacon Flight. Also get your bloody mary with the jalapeno bacon. We enjoyed our food and the service was on par with a cafe. The prices are right! :)

Okay, so my rating is a 3.5, and typically I round down. But for this place i rounded up because they prepared the hashbrowns how i like it. Thin and crispy.  They had delicious benedict. I love their hollandaise they used. Definitely worked its way into my top 2 of favorite hollandaise.   I really hope to try some more dishes, here.

Awesome place... My wife brought some of their bacon home and it was delicious (recommend the jalapeño bacon). We were seated quickly and our server (Nikol) got our coffees right away. BTW they do carry heavy cream for us fat connoisseurs. I ordered the Oink omelette, a 5-egg bacon sausage filled monster (see pic). Great food, great service. Give them a try if your by PV mall...

The bank trial was amazing but the best was the donut covered with bacon, it was to die for! I loved the capitan crunch toast too! I wish I would have tried the bloody mary but I didnt see it until we left. It gives me a reason to go back again! Super fun and super delicious. Very kid friendly too!

All the people who've complained are just snobby cry babies who were more than likely that kid who screamed in the parking lot at their parents for the $300 pink pony to match his/her purple, orange, yellow, green, and blue ones that already reside in their bedroom windowsill.  Service? Seen way worse..Food? I'm the biggest skeptic when it comes to getting your money's worth and tend to complian like the pony girl/guy. Nitpick at everything. Ok hypocrisy, yes. Be that as it may, I still have to admit that their bacon cheese burger has to be by far the best I have had in a long long time.  Keep it up guys. Wish you had dinner hours. Let's get rid of Denny's and IHOP crap.    P.S. They do have alcohol

With the slogan of "breakfast, lunch, and bacon", I would expect the restaurant to have multiple interesting and fun dishes with a focus on quality bacon. If this is what you are looking for, do not visit oink.   The service was ok, family run it seemed. A little disorganized, but it hasn't been open long so I'm sure that this will get better.  The food is standard breakfast and lunch. Most items do not include bacon as an ingredient and there are only 1-2 fun bacon dishes (such as bacon pancakes).  I ordered the French toast combo with honey cured bacon and hash browns. The French toast was ok, pretty typical. The hash browns were not fully cooked and the bacon was not very impressive and tasted like the cheap stuff you pick up at your local grocery store.  I strongly recommend that the owner check out some good bacon focused meat companies such as Broadbent, who has an amazing dry-cured bacon. If you like good bacon, join the zingerman's bacon club which will introduce you into several tasty varieties from across the country.  Oink should rethink its menu and name and try to bring the two in line with each other.   Good luck oink, the idea is great but execution needs a little work.

I thought I should write an update, as since my first visit 4 months ago I have dined there abput 8 times.  My experiences have never been as good as my first visit.  The omelet has not once been fluffy like the first time.  Since I cook a lot, cooking a flat omelet isn't a challenge so I'd just as soon keep the $20 in my pocket.  In addition, the last time I visited I ordered a side of bacon and it was delivered cold - not warm, cold, cooked but cold.  The restaurant was not busy, perhaps 35% capacity.  Flat omelets and cold bacon isn't worth the price.  I don't think I'll return, too many other places to try.

What a great place!  Went there for breakfast while in town.  The day we went a local television station was there doing a live shot.  Despite that we were greeted and  seated as soon as we walked in.  The waitress was very friendly without bring overbearing.  The Bacon Bloody Mary was one of the best I have ever had.  Our food came out quickly.  It was very full of flavor.  The flight of bacon was excellent.  The Ranchero Sauce was made by someone who really knew what they were doing.  The taste was exciting and full of flavor.  The servings were plentiful without leaving me feeling like I ate too much.  The owner stopped at our table despite the large crowd that was on hand to say hello and check on us. An excellent place which will be on my short list to visit again.

My Fiancee and I love trying new local places for breakfast/brunch every weekend, it's become some what of a ritual for us and something I look forward to during the week. We love supporting local businesses so we were excited to give Oink a shot.  When we arrived at Oink, the Hostess seemed to be a bit flustered and didn't initially greet us and check us in... This was not a bad sign to me, just a new business still trying to work out the qinks.  Once we were seated, the menu looked great. I decided to go for my breakfast favorite, Eggs Benedict (listed as a 'specialty item' on their menu). My Fiancee ordered the French toast and we also ordered a side of bisquits & gravy and sausage. What a DISPAPPOINTMENT! You would think with a name like 'Oink' you would be getting the best breakfast meats one could imagine, this was not the case. The ham on my Eggs Benedict was as thin as a piece of pepporoni (no joke!), our side of breakfast links looked like they were microwaved and tasted like it too. The Eggs Benedict was by far the most disgusting dish I think I have ever ordered, when it first came out, the eggs were clearly over done- more like hard boiled then poached.  However, what made the dish disgusting was the 'hollandaise sauce', it was not hollandaise sauce. It was the color of milk and had the constinancy of half and half and there was so much on my plate that it became Eggs Benedict cereal, literally. The english muffins were soaking in this thin liquid that gave off the smell of yogurt, eww. Even though it looked appalling, I decided to try it. Just to give you an idea, I had to plug my nose in order to chew and swallow it! It was AWFUL. My Fiancee's french toast was good and so was the coffee but thats it. The bisquits and gravy weren't anything special and I was only happy we ordered it because of how completely inedible the Eggs Benedict were. Long story short, if Oink plans on succeeding, they need Gordon Ramsey to come in and help them out. Sorry Oink, I really did want to love you :(  I will NOT be visiting again.
Food was decent enough. I appreciate that they offer corn tortillas instead of toast. However, the restaurant was freezing, and thus I have to give it four stars.

So I thought they were open to 3. I walk in at 1:45 to learn they close at 2. So, I placed a to go order and sat at the front to wait. While I'm waiting the staff is sitting around the front service area complaining about customers that walk in close to closing. Forgive, but a customer who is spending money is the same at an hour to closing as they are at 15 minutes to closing. My last visit

Had the two egg breakfast with sugar cured bacon.  The breakfast was pretty good except for the bacon!  The hash browns actually had flavor and the eggs were cooked perfectly.  The sour dough toast was good too and not hard as a brick! The bacon was rubbery and limp, didn't even eat it.  Also ordered the "flight of bacon" which is one slice of each of the 8 flavors of bacon that they offer. Cost is $10.99 which was a waste of money.  Only 1 piece was thoroughly cooked (the jalapeno), the others were rubbery and undercooked.  Was very disappointed.  I mentioned it to the waitress and she offered to get another one, declined.  She said we should of asked for crispy bacon, that this is the way the bacon is always cooked.....hmmmmm.  Cost of entire meal was kinda high $50+ for 3 people (also we ordered the $10.99 "flight of bacon"), maybe go back for a special occasion.  Will go back, just won't have any bacon.
So delicious!!!  The bloody Mary's were perfection along with our breakfast. Recommend the jalapeño bacon . Only wish we had this chain in Cali :)

Seriously...it's called Oinks but where is the bacon? I ordered an omlet with bacon in it...should have been fabulous with big chunky pieces of GOOD bacon. What did I receive? An ok nothing special omlet I could have gotten anywhere. My husband's omlet was the same. He ordered the one with the shredded meat on it.... can't even recall what it was....but it not anything even worth remembering. Let me say, the concept of Oinks seems good as does the decor and such, but come on, there should be more bacon choices in the menu (options with bacon in them) and when a dish states there is bacon in it, it should be awesome, chunky, full of flavor bacon - nothing like we experienced. Sorry guys.....unimpressed.....you need to live up to your name.

In true Reese fashion I showed up late to the breakfast club shindig. But the server only let me sit there about 12 minutes before asking me if I'd like anything to drink. "Yes please, water. Thank you. Oh, and may I have a menu please?" IMO I shouldn't have to ask for that. She should have brought it over when she realized I was new to the table. Whatever. I wasn't really, REALLY hungry yet anyway.   I looked over the menu and by the time she delivered my water I had already decided on the eggs plate with jalapeño bacon. The food was pretty bland. I doused it in pepper and chollula and a bit of salt. Also, if your gimmick is bacon, you had better be damn good at it! The jalapeño bacon was definitely nothing to write home about and a friend who had ordered the bacon flight was only moderately impressed. Definitely not worth the cost in this case. Oh well. What are ya gonna do? Oh I know. Not order that again. The French toast looked yummy and if I lived on this side of town I might bring my sonny man back for breakfast.   In conclusion I feel the entire experience was simply mediocre.

I have been meaning to stop in to Oink Cafe for sometime now and I am happy to say it was just as i expected. The Bacon flight was delicious and juicy! I oredered the biscuits and gravy along with the flight for a amazing breakfast the portions are exceptionally big and come with plenty of food! i will of course come back! I had the pleasure of meeting the owner who checked on me a couple of times to ask what i thought of the food. Great staff all around wish only the best for the busnies.

There aren't a ton of non-chain breakfast places in that area, so this fits the bill if you're looking for a standard breakfast/brunch. The restaurant is a lot larger than it appears from the outside, and there entrance is actually on the backside of the building. The bacon flight wasn't as awesome as we were hoping for, but overall, a decent option if you're in the neighborhood and sick of Chompie's.

Great food and great service. Order the flight of bacon. It's outstanding. Also the Arizona omelet is great. They actually have tasty hash browns too. It was quick and delicious. I highly recommend it.

Horrible service.  We had waited 45 minutes and still didn't have our food. The table next to us came in 20 minutes after us, ate their food, and left.  At one point the server brought us our drinks and said "let me go put down my tray and I will come right back to take your order".  It took her 15 minutes to put down her tray.  She also said "sorry your food isn't up yet, we had a large table ahead of yours", she was saying this as another table next to us, who had ordered after us was receiving their food.  I am sure she took our order and had to "put down her tray" before she sent the order to the kitchen.  We left without eating.

A Café devoted to Bacon? Count me in!   Paid Oink a visit for the last Breakfast Club UYE of 2013. Fantastic turnout, too. Shout out to Monica O. for running this like it's her job, oh yeah!   Ordered the two eggs, scrambled, with hashbrowns, toast, and jalapeño and applewood smoked bacon.   The eggs were cooked nicely; however, the hash browns were lacking in flavor. While the bacon was tasty, I wasn't impressed. It was overcooked. There is such a thing as too much crunch to the bacon.   Cheryl B. let me try one of her maple bacon donut holes . . . So good! Had to restrain myself from buying a box to take home.  I would definitely make the drive from Chandler to give Oink another try . .  Especially for that FULL bacon flight!
Nice alternative to the typical IHOP places. Good food and neat concept, and our waitress was a blast! Liked it so much we bought a mug!

The bacon is phenomenal! It was literally the best bacon I've ever had. I also ordered a Belgian waffle, which was fluffy and flavorful. I think they sprinkle pumpkin pie spices on top as well. Everything was really good but I can't get over how amazing the Apple smoked bacon was.

I work a few doors down and have been waiting for them to open for months! Today was my first visit and I wasn't disappointed!  The owner and servers were friendly and the food was fantastic! I will definitely come back.

Took the server 7 mins to come over just for our drink order. But the food was fast, menu looked appealing overall. I had the french toast (original) which was good. Nothing special. My partner had the country fried steak which appeared to have canned gravy. Still tasted fine, nothing special. I would probably return, but only if I lived nearby. Which I don't.

Very good! We live nearby. We got the pork confit Benedict and the strawberry cheesecake pancakes. They were delicious. I was worried the strawberry sauce would be goopy red sugar syrup like from IHOP but it was fresh puréed .

This place is amazing. The service today was awesome. I had pancakes and it was so yummy plus the flight of bacon- the jalapeño bacon is my favorite! My boyfriend had the California chicken sandwich which the waitress said to try it in a burrito instead of the bun, and that just made it so delicious!

We were here for brunch with a large group. The staff did a great job of accommodating us and once we ordered keeping everything straight. I had the 50/50 burger, which was really tasty. The Cole slaw side was a bit sparse. My husband had a traditional Eggs Benedict, which he raved about. And for him, hash browns is the best indicator of a great breakfast, and these were great. The rest of the group seemed to enjoy their meals as well, although there was some question about whether the different bacons really tasted different.
This place is always crowded, so there is a wait but the food is worth it. The portions are big and the service is great.

Oink is pretty much a standard Food Service breakfast spot. The butter comes in individual plastic cups so you need to work at it to butter your pancakes. Nothing special on the pancakes, standard batter.  The juices comes out of a Food Service dispenser which is prominently displayed behind the counter. My food was tepid and the Food Service Hash Browns were not crisped very well. Service was ok, bacon was tasty but cold. For the money, I will dine at a Mom and Pop spot instead that cares a bit more about quality ingredients.

Potential there but this place needs a tune up.  Service is sub par. Slow to get meals and disinterested in giving good service. The amount of dust on the ceiling vents is a bit disgusting. Maple bacon donuts were dry. Probably not coming back.

Great breakfast. And if you like bacon...they have 8...yes 8 flavors!  You can get a flight and try them all! Everything was very fresh and served timely and correctly. Also, the cinnamon roll with bacon on top ( check the display of baked goods)

Liked the food, but the service was a bit slow for our party of 7.  As someone who has worked as a breakfast food server, I know that the morning meal is fast paced and it may take The Oink a little time to get things in sync.  I definitely like the bacon concept and will try this place again.  You can read my full review here:   http://touristoflife.me/2012/03/25/the-oink-cafe-brkfst-lunch-bacon/

This is a great little breakfast and lunch place with a serious pork fat problem. Think bacon in flavors you may not have thought of. Had a bacon eggs benedict that was really great!. our group also had an amazing pumpkin spice pancake and the florentine omelet. All were very very good. If you like bacon try a bacon flight. 6 pieces each with a different flavor!! This place gets busy so expect a short wait but its is zoo worth it. Here is a tip. They have opened one of these in Tucson and are planning to open in Tempe soon. Do go here!

Went for brunch, ordered the Chimi. So good!!   Would I come back? YES!  Food: 4  Service: 5+ (wonderful waitress)  I ordered the CHIMI,if you come here you must order. Sooo friggen good and HUGE.   The bacon donut was the SHIT. They warm it up for you!   Other food was okay: - bacon tasting, they all tasted the same  - southwest omelette was good - chicken fried steak was a little chewy

We went right after they opened which probably was a mistake. Our waitress explained that some of the staff had not shown up for work so it mostly family members working that day. It took a long time to get our food other tables that were seated after us got there food before we did. When the food arrived it was not very bland and tasted a little strange. I really want this place to succeed, so I will try it again once the grease has built up on the grill.

Had an amazing time at the oink café.  Amazing food and had the best waitress named Emma.  She was so on top of everything, got our food to us fast, and had an amazing personality that brightened my day.  We will definitely be returning.

Tried this place for breakfast a few weeks ago on a Saturday. Extremely long wait for food. 1 hour to be exact. 3 men came in and sat down beside us and it was obvious one of them had the hots for the waitress. They both flirted back and forth the entire time.  Amazingly they got their food in 10 minutes. After  I saw that I spoke up and asked "what's is going on here"? she said she they must know someone in the kitchen, haha. Needless to say that's all we needed to hear. Ba bye Oink, we won't be seeing you again.
So delicious and located right next to paradise valley mall. It was pretty busy for a week day but still only like five min wait. Maple bacon donuts were awesome

One of my favorite places near my work. I go here for my work meetings, and love it. Food is great, staff is great, and the location is great. I can't wait for them to open one in south chandler near my house, I ask each time I go in so far no go! But love it and recommend this place!
Service was slooooow, but the food was decent. Not a great first impression, but I am all about second chances. Will try it again.

It's a 4 star based solely on the name and the bacon flight!  The jalapeño bacon was out of this world but that being said everything else was lackluster. Their famous sauce was just a red Chile base that was thick and didn't feel right slopped on top of the omelette I had but the pork was killer and their bacon donut was tasty.

Was enticed firstly by the name, due to the fact that I am a huge fan of bacon (who isn't!)  Looks like they were short a hostess but my server who sat me (Sarah) was incredible! Energetic lady who seemed to had been taking care of most tables in the place and did an awesome job. Very nice, and very fast.  Ordered the paradise valley omelette and was decent, my hash browns were very greasy and the bread not the best quality but still was overall pretty delicious.  The oink Bloody Mary was absolutely delicious, seems like the dollar up-charge from the regular Bloody Mary was a dollar for the bacon, worth it!   The place doesn't seem to have any music playing and the lighting is a little fluorescent, but other than those few things, it's a great cafe!   4/5

We love Oink. Reminds me of Iowa. I even wore my Iowa shirt today with a pig on it that says "bacon is our second language." Love everything about Oink. Bacon, bacon and more bacon I say! Never had bad service like some of the reviews. Yes it gets busy but that is what happens when a place is popular. Eggs Benedict is the best!! I wish I lived closer so I could eat here every weekend! My review is 5 strips if bacon...or stars if you must.
Great spot lovely staff and the food was delicous overall nice experience would definetly go back

Got a flight of bacon and a cheeseburger. 8 different types of bacon ranging from spicy to sweet, burger was big and juicy. I went with two kids and they ate all of their food which is always a challenge!

Oink definitely has a good thing going. The service is great and so is the food. Sometimes there is a little bit of a wait but trust me it's well worth waiting. Everything I have had there is good. And one of the best things to order is a bacon flight especially if it's your first time in. Enjoy!

This place has been wonderful for the many years I've been coming here. Great breakfast, unparalleled bacon and the best mac and cheese ever. Today however, I feel empty inside as I sit here waiting for a 50/50 burger... They were out of noodles... I shouldn't be as upset as I am, but I am. I have been craving that delectable plate of oozey mac and cheese for a couple days now. I won't rant, I'll just leave you with this.... If their mac and cheese  (with the jalapeños and jalapeño bacon.) can devastate me so much, you should probably give it a try and see why..

Flight of Bacon. Bomb! When in Rome...Loved trying different flavors and such a cool presentation! Other menu selections: Mac and Cheese w applewood bacon (normally jalapeño bacon is served in it but somebody does not like spicy...yet. ) I had a few bites thought way too heavy. 50/50 burger w fries. Nothing special there. Dry and flavorless :( I did Pork Confit Benny and it was okay. Kiddo said my pulled pork is way better at home :) but still enjoyed eating it. Home fries were cooked nice and I liked peppers and onions in it. Don't live in the area so doubtful we would make a special trip back here.

The best place for Breakfast and Bacon in the valley! Portions are generous and filling. Never had a bad experience, staff will recognize you and acknowledge you even if you don't sit in their section. Love this place! Definitely a must visit restaurant!

Delicious! Long wait but was worth it.We grabbed drinks & bacon doughnut holes from the coffee bar while waiting. Love their vanilla lattes, amazing omelets, and you have not lived until you've had a flight of bacon.

The food is awesome. The bacon flight is amazing.  But our server was literally the most miserable and inattentive woman. She spoke very condescending when speaking to me and we saw the rest of the staff more than we ever saw her. She rolled her eyes when I informed her that she over charged me on orange juice but no wonder she was confused! She never came to the table! She had short black hair, glasses and a Green Bay Packer jeweled shirt on. If you want to enjoy your amazing meal at Oink, specifically ask to avoid her section because she absolutely didn't deserve the 20% tip I left her out of courtesy because she basically made us feel like our table was a burden to her. I wish I could have tipped the nice girl who got us OJ refills and filled our waters instead. I would have rated 5 stars if she wasn't so unpleasant to deal with.

We celebrated my birthday at Oink Cafe today.  Our first time so we shared the flight of  bacon which was enjoyable.  I ordered the blueberry pancakes which were plentiful and juicy.  Quality of tuna in daughter's sandwich was high.  Mimosa was ok but not something I would want to repeat.  Biggest challenge is that I am a short person and the tables are too high.  As a result I had some major spillage on my clothing.  After brunch we had to run to Ross and purchase a replacement blouse so I could continue my Bday activities.

Ate here for the first time today after living right around the corner for months. I had the pork benedict with home fries and a side of bacon while my friend got the denver omelette. The pork was dry, I was given the wrong kind of bacon. His omelette was ok but the biscuit on the side was so stale we joked about throwing it against a wall. I really don't understand how this place has 3.5 stars. Giving it 2 because the bloody Mary's were decent minus the entire stalk of celery taking up space where more vodka could be. The home fries were awesome. Service was friendly. Won't be going back - not nearly worth a $43 breakfast for two.

First off I'm trying to be more adventurous with my food choices and was in the area and decided to come here for lunch with my babe..she wasn't so sure about it as she's not big on meat and bacon to be exact   Came during the last hour that they were open and the place was still packed and very busy. If I hadn't notice the sign that said it closes at 2 pm, I wouldn't have known that this place could be cleared out in an hour!! Anyways, decided to see how long the wait would be and was seated immediately.   The waitress came over shortly after being seated and took our order. The wait between ordering and our food coming out was close to 20 minutes! I guess not too bad, but we noticed that people that came in after us were getting their orders much sooner then us. Maybe it was because of my order. Anyways, food finally came out and was much larger in size then I had expected. Babe didn't enjoy her food, even though it was just a turkey sandwich. She said it was very plain and had no flavor to it. I on the other hand ordered the Ranchero Chimichanga which was delicious. It was VERY filling tho and felt like I overate when I was done. I didn't even get around to eating my side of fries (came with the order).   This place is very popular and tables were always filling up as soon as someone left. Good thing the tables were cleaned immediately and floors swept as soon as someone left. Our waitress seemed to have half the tables, so she didn't come around to us but one time. Was very friendly though.   May try this place out again if in the area and hungry.

We have been here a handful of times, but I have never taken the time time to write a review until today. We went out to celebrate Father's Day a little early since we won't be in town for the next few weekends. Anyway, we happen to mention it just in conversation and the next thing we know, our waitress brought over some complimentary bacon donuts. Then the manager stopped by to welcome us and just say hello and happy Father's Day! I have to say the service today was phenomenal. We felt so special and just loved being there today. The food has always been good, but the service today is what will make us go back sooner rather than later!!! Thanks guys!!
Great brunch spot with lots to choose from.  Server was very nice and the food was cooked perfectly.

I tried, oink cafe, I tried. I came and ate your food a number of times. I had your coffee. I had your juice. But no matter what I had it made no use.  It seems your staff would be somewhere else. It seems you buy the cheese that comes pre-melt. I want to love you and to tip you well. Because you're right there and you could be so swell.  But I work hard for the little money I make. At a restaurant in fact so I know what's at stake. It's not with pride that I make this 2 star review. It's in hope that the truth will motivate you.  But for real, I've come in here like 6 times over the course of 8 weeks. The food is mediocre, edible greasy spoon stuff but that doesn't match the scenery. Though the staff is nice enough, I had the (mis)pleasure of sitting at the "bar" which apparently is where the staff goes to do their b****ing and I was thoroughly disappointed, particularly by the older one with silver hair - she doesn't seem like she has one sympathetic molecule in her body. All face value nothing genuine there at all. Anyway, I can handle all that I work at a bar and restaurant I know how it goes. But the final straw was waiting a longer than it took to cook and eat my food for me to receive my check. Quite actually, 21 minutes. And it wasn't even my server who noticed.

Pretty standard fare for breakfast; good pancakes and bacon but the service needs a serious kick in the pants. Half empty, 4 servers and the server that seated us couldn't remember that she seated us and needed to wait on us. Food took forever, bill took forever.

How can you not want to eat here?! The sign says "Breakfast, Lunch, Bacon"!!!  I had a chorizo and egg burrito that was really tasty.  I also had a maple bacon donut that very nearly put me in a (delicious and satisfactory) sugar coma!  The patio was wonderful, the service punctual, and the company was the best!  I will be back!

First time there.  I came at the end of their day, so it wasn't crowded.  Ordered the Pork Confit Omelette.  It was tasty and a LOT of food.  I love bacon but wasn't in the mood to try the flight today.  Next time!  I had a biscuit with my lunch -- it was quite tasty, as were the homefries.  A great place for breakfast.

We visited on a Monday at lunch. There were plenty of tables and service was fine; we requested to get our ticket right after our food was delivered, and we were obliged.  The infamous bacon flight is impressive, though expensive. It IS very high quality bacon--much better than what I usually get at the grocery store. The taste differences are quite noticeable.   I had the strawberry chicken salad. It was the full size, and it wasn't huge.Okay, I knew this was a place known for breakfast food and bacon, and yeah, the salad was just okay. The chicken didn't have a lot of flavor and had obviously just been pulled from the fridge. It wasn't bad by any means.  My husband had four pancakes. He's a guy with a big appetite, and he was defeated by these pancakes. They took up a whole platter. The sample I had was light, fluffy, and everything a pancake should be.   Oink Cafe definitely knows their breakfast stuff. It's pretty far from us, but I'd be okay with visiting again if we were in the area.

I enjoyed this place. Very relaxed and the food was decent. They have an interesting take on breakfast focusing on bacon this and bacon that.   The food was about average I had biscuits and gravy, the coffee was good. To be honest it was a little in the pricy side for breakfast but the portions were large.   It's worth checking out, maybe a more bacon centric dish will rock your world.  I would have been happier with a smaller more flavorful breakfast for the price. ~personal preference~

I had the best Eggs Benedict ever!!  Their hollandaise sauce was unbelievable.  Our server, I believe her name was Natalie was fantastic. She put up with the antics of my friend.  Our food came out within minutes of ordering, and it is a great little neighborhood find!  I will be back!

Our breakfasts at The Oink Café (Paradise Valley) were delicious and accompanied by super tasty bacon and sausage sides. I wanted to sample a variety of their bacons, so I ordered a basic breakfast of two eggs with hash browns, then added a half-flight (4 pieces) of bacon, and 2 sausage links.  I was in Heaven! My wife ordered the Oink French Toast Combo with a sweet crumb crust topped with whipped cream and strawberry sauce, berries and sugar, plus an egg with bacon. She savored every bite!  They also serve espresso drinks, premium beer, and cocktails - especially Bloody Marys. Everything is fresh and service is very good.  Definitely recommended.

It was super busy when we got there, but we were seated quickly and the service was pretty good. Granted, we went on a Sunday morning, so I shouldn't have been surprised at how busy it was. The food was great and the poinsettia (drink) was awesome. Overall, it was a good experience and I would definitely go back there in the future.

Who doesn't like bacon? Been coming here for almost two years now and it's fairly consistent. The bacon is ok, but nothing that has me doing backflips. Service is usually very good, as we've learned to request Autumn if she's working. The restaurant is very clean and the food is good during off-peak times. When it's busy, forget it... break out the dice, because it's hit and miss when it comes to quality. Neat niche though.

Favorite place for breakfast on the weekends for my husband and I! I always get the chorizo skillet with home fries and he gets the eggs benedict with hashbrowns. It's all so so good and the service is great every time too!  Can get kinda pricey (we usually drop close to $40 for us two) but so worth it!

Here is my pigtail.   When I can, I will stop in a new restaurant, meet and greet the owners and look over the menu to see something traditional and something new. What catches my eye here is the bacon. You know bacon will never let you down.  I learn from the owner that he hires the chef, over several qualifications but will have to cook one meal to get the job. So I decide to order the job winning meal.   I was really not all that interested in testing chef's speed, artistry and creativity, nope I want a winter savory meal representing his interpretation of the classic Eggs Benedict $9, and a side of jalapeño bacon $3.   Everybody enjoys a surprise ingredient and the jalapeño heat in the bacon was a winner. The flavor of the Hollandaise sauce was rich and buttery with that ever so slight lemon tang. The perfect poached egg too.  Lunch the next day I had a club sandwich. A excellent sandwich born from the remnants of many delicious things.
