Three slices of thin white toast, choice of bacon and I chose honey bacon since I already enjoyed jalapeño bacon the previous day. Lettuce, tomato, honey cured ham, turkey and a little mayo and spices. There are three choices of fries, regular, thick and sweet. This meal is very large. $8. http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/gugN1sgyheBJ6aKtNcv_gQ?selected=UAcma3FjSfkUnnRZkvLGyA  One last note, the meats are oven cooked in this kitchen, roast beef next up. The staff and the owners are kind and thoughtful. There are plenty of pros to dining here and I have yet to see a con.

Good Food ...Big Portions ...Bacon choices   But .... The employees were sitting at the bar area ,  talking loudly the entire time we we're attempting to enjoy our breakfast ... Annoying and unprofessional ... A high school atomsphere that really made for a bad experience ...suggestion take all that horsing around and chatter to the break room ...

Been driving by this place for years and finally decided to try it out! My advise is: go, Go GO! This place was great! Bacon EVERYTHING! YUMMY! Don't walk, RUN NOW! Amazing place. Now i can't wait to go back!!!
We have since been back a couple more times.  They've got it together now. Solid breakfast spot...  Good service, good food, good prices.

This place was super busy! That's always a good sign! The Barista I think her name was Rachel offered to seat us at the outside bar. There were people there but just waiting for tables, she was super polite and made great recommendations as it was our first Oink experience. She was great a multitasking the phones and remained super attentive.   The eggs were delicious and the bacon was seriously amazing. I had honey cured and jalapeño, both were cooked perfectly.   Overall we will be back, super friendly wait staff, delicious food!

Love this place.  And being kid friendly is a huge plus for us.  We have had the pleasure of eating here several times and have never been disappointed.  Wait staff has always been friendly and pleasant.  We do not  mind waiting on average 20-30 minutes.  It is worth it.  Love this neighborhood cafe.
Pretty weak, it's a Dennys disguised as some sort of niche bacon place

Positives first: my bloody Mary was really good. My boyfriend and I both thought our breakfasts were good. Sad realities: this place is always so crowded. I went twice and left after being told there was a 45 minute wait for a table. On the third time, we had a 20 minute wait. But once we were seated, our waitress was so busy and overloaded that it took 15 minutes to get our WATER. As a former waitress, I know I'm not being unreasonable in saying that THAT is UNREASONABLE. And then we ordered 2 different side orders of bacon (jalapeño and honey-cured), thinking that a place that supposedly specializes in bacon would have mind-blowing bacon. No. It was normal bacon. Our lives were not changed. It's a cute place but I would not recommend it to anyone unless I knew they had NO other plans for the day, because they would have to spend most of their morning sitting and waiting for average bacon.

Average.  I had the Arizona omelette and it was smothered a little too much, couldn't even taste the omelette.   The potatoes tasted like something you could buy at a hospital cafeteria.  The coffee was hot and decent.   There is nothing special about this place and would rather have home-cooked  and tasty, unique food than a bright atmosphere with a trendy name.
They told us it would be a 20 minute wait. We waited 40 minutes. We ordered premium coffees and they were cold.

I've eaten breakfast at Oink several times and had a great meal and comfortable experience every time.  I love eggs benedict and their menu contains several versions of it. The maple-bacon donut is fantastic, too, but this place obviously isn't much for vege choices. Other than that, I like this restaurant for the diversity of customers it attracts from the local area. I think my only complaint is that each dish on their menu seems overpriced by a dollar or two, considering the average sized portions they serve. Overall this is a casual, top-notch place for breakfast but a little pricey compared to, say, the I-HOP right across the street.

Finally tried this place and overall enjoyed the experience. We went on a Sunday morning and it was busy. Good sign and even better, it didn't effect our brunch.  Our party of  6 was seated almost immediately. We had two young kids so it was great that we were.  Our server was helpful despite the rush and our food arrived   quickly.   Now the menu lived up to its namesake. Bacon was omnipresent! Bacon scones, bacon pancakes, a bacon sampler to name a few. The bacon items were great yet outside of them the rest of the food was rather ordinary, typical breakfast fare.  It was good yet nothing different if it wasn't bacon centered.  All in all good time and would come back to enjoy the bacon goodies. Maybe the rest of the menu will catch up with its star.

ONE star for cold breakfast food that has the potential to be much better.   The two of us took the open seats at the bar counter because the wait time for other tables was a usual 20 minutes (no, not long but we were on a schedule today so we needed to get in and out fairly quickly). As other reviewers recently posted, I'm not sure why there was much of a wait at all since there were 6 others tables open to seat customers. Strange.   We waited over 30 minutes for our food to come out only to be significantly disappointed by what we bit into. Neither of our Benedicts were even lukewarm and the bacon that is "raved" about was certainly nothing special. If you are going to feature a specialty item such as a bacon tasting board it better be something memorable! This was anything but that- very lightly flavored and pretty thin. We both said to each other that our food would have been great if it were hot. It's a shame- these foodies won't be back and certainly won't recommend Oink.   Ours weren't the only gripes- we overheard the staff quietly noting how many complaints there were today. I just don't get it. Breakfast is the easiest meal to cook. Management needs to get this place together!!!  Also was quite turned off by one of the back-of-the-house fellas that frequented the front bar area with a cigarette hanging behind the ear- SOO unappealing. What if that fell in someone's food!?!!  Noting that although we had an unfortunate experience, we appreciated that management took our concerns seriously. Thank you for that.
Took 3 kids for breakfast, 2 boys had pigs in a blanket. Pancakes fine but sausage was soaked in grease. Nice location, Nice servers, not impressed with food. Only open for breakfast and lunch.

Not impressed. Ordered Ham steak and eggs for $8.99. If the ham was shoe leather it would'nt be enough leather to resole my 18mo grandsons shoe. $3.99 for one dinky biscuit with gravy (which was horrible) come on. hash browns were cold and flavorless. service was so-so. You need to get it together. there are better breakfast restaurants out there competing for your dollar. I  would not go out of my way to return

Died. and. gone. to. heaven.  Bacon sampler, sublime. The only way this place could possibly be better is if you could buy their bacon by the pound and bring it home to cook. Because I would live on a steady diet of their honey bacon.   They have a lot of other delicious food, too. But I don't care. Because flights of bacon. OMG.

This is a great place. Always make sure to bring the family all 26 of us when in town!   They have Great service . All it takes is a call and they can find room! We try to go early because we have such a good time here!  Who Doesn't Love Bacon 7 different kinds! and their  food is wonderfull!!  Fluffy pancakes, Crispy Bacon, Great Eggs Benedict! and I caould go on you just have to try it to believe it.  and did I mention 7 different kinds of bacon love it

We had wanted to try the Oink Cafe for a long time. Unfortunately, we tried it today.  We went late, our fault, and there was a wait. Only about 20 min and they were accurate in their estimate of the wait. The decor is, I don't know, off. There are large images of pigs on the wall in some places and big expanses of empty wall in others. Oh, and the colors are a little much for a breakfast restaurant.  Initially the service was good, but that deteriorated too.  The worst part was the food. I ordered a build your own omelette and my partner had Ham Steak and eggs with a tortilla. He's on a low carb regimen right now. He enjoyed his, but the presentation was lackluster at best. Two eggs (ordered over medium and cooked over easy) the ham steak and a tortilla all on a white plate. No garnish, just white eggs, a slightly pink piece of ham and a beige totilla on a white plate. Not very appetizing at all! I felt sorry for him.  I ordered an egg white omlette with spinach, tomatoes and cheddar. I would have preferred Feta, but they don't have it on the menu. Mine came with home fries and an English Muffin. Oh, and the omellette I received was regular eggs not egg whites. Yes, I could have said something, but I was starving at that point and just wanted to eat. The weirdest part of the omlette was the cheese on the outside. Who the heck puts cheese on the outside of an omlette?  For $25 bucks for two I would have expected more food and better quality.  After brunch we made a quick stop at Target, but then we had to run home as the meal made me ill.   Sorry Oink, we won't be back.
Fun breakfast place.  The flight of bacon is a great idea - can't have too much bacon.  Service was good on our last visit.  Good selection of breakfast items.

So here is the deal.  I have been to Oink twice before and although I liked it I was not blown away or anything.  I would say it was slightly above average.  But I also knew there was something special about this place.  So recently I went back for the third time and I discovered something great.   So for years now if anyone mentioned chicken fried steak there was only one place that came to mind.  Texaz Grill.  Everyone agrees that they have the best chicken friend steak in town.  Well I am here to tell you,  there is a new player in town.  Oink has amazing, amazing chicken fried steak.  I would have to say that Oink and Texaz Grill are 1 and 1A.  in no particular order.    Also maybe it was because I was enjoying my food so much that the service was also exceptional that day.    I am very much looking forward to my next visit to Oink.
I've had the jalapeno bacon stuffed pancakes, they're to die for every bite is hot and sweet...we've never had a bad meal and always recommend it!

I went here today to try out the new local breakfast joint and just get something to go. I stood at the to go window for about 15 minutes before having to flag someone down to finally help me. I ordered the Maple bacon donut which they only had one left and it was kinda crumbled so the manager said I could have it for free which i thought was great and super nice of him but the waitress still charged me which, i wasn't going to haggle over it. So in regards to the service the manager was super nice and fantastic. The waitress left a lot to be desired but i won't hold that against the restaurant.   sooo, back to the food. the bacon maple donut is a cake donut with crunchy bacon sprinkled on top all glazed over. I thought it was good but not great. The donut seemed a little over cooked so u didn't get that soft middle but the taste was nice. a nice salty almost toffee like crunch from the bacon with a little bit of sweetness from the maple glaze. I could of used a little bit more sweetness at the tail end though.   I also ordered their bacon flight which comes with 8 different types of bacon including applewood, hone cured, jalapeno, peppered, sugar cured, hickory, apple cider, and pecanwood. The bacon left  a lot to be desired with only the peppered and jalapeno sticking out. Otherwise i wouldn't of been able to tell the others apart. I cleared my pallet after each piece to taste the different notes but they just weren't there. The bacon wasn't bad, don't get me wrong but it tasted like the bacon u would get at waffle house.   Overall I think a 3 out of 5 is pretty accurate. I like what there trying to do and I liked the manager but the execution is not there yet. We don't have many good local restaurants on this side of town so I really hope they can find a winning formula.

I was staying just down the street for a work training and arrived early so I had some time to explore. The woman at the front desk of my hotel said hands down Oink was the place to go if I wanted a good local spot. She was so right! A place with 8 types of bacon on the menu had to be at least okay, right?! The service was good, everyone was very sweet and attentive.  I got the pork confit omelet and it was good. The pork was super tender and really well seasoned. It's a ton of food, omelet toast and a side of your choice. I got the ranchero sauce on the side and I'm glad I did because it was spicy so I don't know I would have wanted it on top of all my omelet. As a sweet treat I got the maple bacon donut, woah baby! It was served nice and warm was cakey and had some nice cinnamon spicing to it, it was a little dry but I was there closer to lunch and I hadn't had a donut in a couple years so I didn't mind.  Overall good breakfast spot!

I learned last time here that they offer gluten free bread so today assumed they could make GF French toast. But the server, Tami,  informed me they were too busy, since it's a weekend, to make me any. Disappointing. We left another restaurant with a long wait to come here. The other restaurant offers way more GF options. Anyway I ordered the two egg breakfast with hash browns and GF toast. My friend had biscuits and gravy. The order came out within minutes so it's clear they were not made to order. Not on a busy Saturday. I will say that the eggs were good but my hash browns were cold. The server did ask is how everything tastes but it was moments after our food came and we hadn't had time to try anything yet! I think the service is hit or miss. The food is decent. I'll probably come back but honestly a few things could be tweaked.

The food was really good and decently priced..... All the way up until 2 sides of gravy like 1/3 cup each and 1/4 cup hollindaise sauce costed over 10$ alone. Didn't tip much due to that over priced surprise. Was nice for a 1 time thing. But prolly won't come back.
Their healthy omelet is so delicious as well as the oink omelet. We did the flight of bacon which was fun as well. Oatmeal is the best. Staff are fantastic. Great experience.

This was the first place we ate at when we moved to Scottsdale, great food, amazing service, and worth any wait.  My husband is the most impatient person but never minds if we have to wait (its usually 15-20 min as they manage their tables and service well). We truly love coming here and highly recommend - especially if you love bacon.

Wasn't very impressed with the pancake combo bacon was normal, pancakes bland, eggs were like I went to a buffet and had been sitting out for a while. Overall I'd say if you don't have taste buds or your a horrible cook at home then you should go here if you actually like what your eating and appreciate quality food don't bother. I think there's an ihop across the street that could do a much better job than these folks

The food here is above average & is reasonably priced. The service is is also good, it's good to see the manager so active in helping his staff busy or slow, it shows a well run operation.   The bacon doughnuts & flavored bacons stand out and are delicious.  However, one of their signature dishes, the pork confit, was very dry & bland. Other than that, I have not had a bad meal & have eating breakfast there for about a year.  If you go on a Saturday or Sunday morning, be prepared to wait 45-60 minutes for a table.

One of the best breakfasts in town. Had the pork confit Benedict and it was perfect. The ambiance is bright and the staff friendly. If you are looking for a treat at moderate price, this is a place for you.

The Oink Cafe, how can you not go here with such a great name.  I ordered a boring breakfast because my stomach was upset. Egg, bacon, French toast and fruit.  It was a busy morning, but we got seated right away.  The manager came by and asked how our food was which was nice.   Can't go wrong with a breakfast cafe, wait yeah you can. But not this one!
Great breakfast place. Next time I am going for the flight of bacon. Friendly and courteous staff who went out of their way to make me feel comfortable and appreciated.

First let me say this.  They have only been open a few days, and I will give them another try AFTER they get all their kinks worked out.  My fiancé and I went Saturday morning around 10am for breakfast.  First there was no one at the door or a sign that said please wait to be seated or seat your self, so we walked up and found a server and asked.  They just said find an open table, which we did.  After 10 minutes we flagged down a server to get a drink order and then menus.  Drinks took forever.  First they ran out of coffee and then coffee mugs.  We sat and watched many people sit down, wait, and then just walk out because no one even acknowledged them.    We got our ordered placed and then heard from other tables around us that they had been waiting over an hour for their food.  Luckily we weren't in a hurry.  I had the cafe fresh toast and my fiancé had some eggs and bacon with a side of biscuits and gravy.  Their food was VERY good.  I Loved mine!  The biscuits and gravy were the best we have had in Phoenix (I'm not too sure if that is saying all that much though).  The food took about 30 minutes.  We constantly had to ask for coffee refills.  I think the servers were doing their best.    Either they were not prepared for a busy morning or they really had no clue what they were doing in the back of the house or front for that matter.  I hope they can pull it together because the food was very good.  Like I said I will go back for another try and re-rate they in a month or two.  I would recommend it to others as long as they know going in that it might be a Cluster.
I liked the atmosphere but the food was very average. I got the donut for dessert but it was really dry, and more like a coffee cake.

Love this place!! I recommend the Oink Bloody Mary if you like bacon in your Bloody Mary. However, the Oink omelette is a pork overload that any pork lover can handle.  One of my favorite places to eat breakfast since moving to Phoenix, Az.

This place is a decent breakfast joint, but the only thing that really makes it stand out are the bacon flights, as the rest of the menu covers the basics you can find just about anywhere else. With that said the apple cider bacon is soooooo so good!  My visit was a combination of decent food and spotty service which amounted to quite the average meal. My dad and I came in for lunch during the week and waited a few minutes to be seated, which is no big deal. However once we were seated we waited, and waited, and waited until my dad finally got a servers attention and asked if we could place our order. I think there was some confusion around who was supposed to take our table, but the waitress helped us. She was nice but definitely a little busy with all of her tables. We asked for two waters, and only got one, then asked for the second and still had to flag someone else down to finally get it. After our food arrived it took awhile to get our bill too. Again, it just seemed like maybe a lack of clear coordination among the entire floor as our waitress was nice herself.   For the food, I got the California omelette with a side of fruit and toast and my dad got a bacon flight and eggs. The omelette was a good size and filling, but there wasn't really anything that stood out about my meal. The bacon flight was of course cool and my dad enjoyed the selection but that was about the only highlight of the meal.   Again, you can get a filling breakfast and try out some different kinds of bacon, but unfortunately overall nothing about this place is really calling me back.
Great breakfast! The jalapeño bacon and apple cider bacon were my favorites.   Will definitely go back again.
I've eaten here 3 times. The food is always good. The service is good. The bacon flight is really tasty. I like the jalapeno bacon the most.

Went for breakfast with friends and was not overly impressed with the food. Two tiny pieces of bacon with "home fries" that appeared to come from frozen. There are far better choices close by. We won't be going back.

Of course, every parent thinks their child is the cutest, smartest, best behaved and many other superlatives.  When we find a restaurant that shares our opinion of our just-turned 2 year old son, well, all the better.  If I could give them 10 stars for service, I definitely would.  We arrived at 10AM to meet our friends for Sunday brunch.  The restaurant was crowded and I was expecting a long wait for a table for 6 adults and the aforementioned toddler.  However, our wait was less than 5 minutes.  Our friends had been there before and ordered 2 flights of bacon for the table to share.  Most of the 8 varieties were good, some were OK and some were outstanding (it's bacon after all, even when it's meh, it's still pretty good).  My favorites were the jalapeno and the pecan wood.  My least favorite was the apple cider, I felt the cider just didn't add anything to the flavor experience.  I ordered the Paradise Valley omelette with fruit and an english muffin.  I thought it was a very nice extra that you got so many choices for sides with the omelettes.  The PV option comes with bacon, mushrooms, spinach and cheese.  The omelette was one of the best I have had in years.  There were two reasons for this.  First, the mushrooms and spinach, both vegetables with high water content, had been properly cooked so they didn't drown the eggs.  Secondly, the ingredients were very evenly dispersed so with each bite, I got the full combination of all the add-ins.  Here's where Oink Cafe went above and beyond, IMHO.  We had visits from a manager and a lady who I assumed was the owner.  The male manager interacted with our son, acknowledging his birthday (our friends had brought him presents) and talking with him and the adults at the table.  The waitress also interacted with our son, refilling his water when he asked for more and treating him like a welcome guest, not some nuisance.  Finally, a lady who I assumed was the manager also stopped by.  She paid special attention to our son, even asking if she could bring him some more fruit when she realized he had eaten all of my side of fruit.  So glad our friends suggested OINK and already looking forward to another visit.  I'll definitely have to take the manager's suggestion of swapping out the regular bacon for the jalapeno bacon on a sandwich.
Found my new breakfast spot when near that area! Customer service was excellent. I had a 2 egg combo with egg whites, fruit, wheat toast and bacon.  Everything was delicious.

We are regulars here. Lana, our server is the best! She is so friendly and knows our order by heart. The owner Donnie walks around to talk to guests and always makes us feel welcome. It's our favorite breakfast place! I highly recommend it!

Breakfast was tasty with eggs cooked to order and the hash browns were cooked beautifully with nice not overwhelming flavor of onions.    We also got half a flight of bacon with different flavors.   Honey glazed, applewood smoked apple cider and jalapenos.  I wanted a crisper bacon bite and more flavor.   Especially for a place called oink.    3.5 stars is where this place rates.  We will come back for the breakfast and fun but not for the bacon.
Great service and excellent place to get breakfast. The eggs Benedict were made perfect! You won't be disappointed by their omelettes either

I suggest you order the Bacon Flight, a sampling of eight varieties of bacon, to accompany whatever else you are ordering. You'll then be on your way to refining your bacon palette. The flight will add about nine bucks to the cost of your meal, but it's a delightful item to share if you are socializing with friends or family. Every visitor to The Oink Café needs to order the flight at least once.  Servers at Oink are very friendly and helpful. They do a nice job of making recommendations and keeping your coffee cup filled. The café itself finds a middle ground, with solid food served at reasonable prices. Not a cheap diner nor a too trendy premium dining spot. The menu is not that innovative, except for a willingness to throw bacon into anything, which is fun. Ordering the eight bacon flight is essential to appreciating the bacon varieties. If nothing else, you'll then know which bacon to request on your next visit. If you don't have this basis for comparison, you'll just think the bacon with your meal is well, bacon. You won't be able to appreciate what differentiates Oink from other breakfast spots.  The restaurant is housed in an odd long and narrow space, but there's a deceptive amount of seating. There can still be a wait, however, at peak times. There is also a small dog friendly patio for outside dining. Oink is kid friendly, with a "little piggies" menu and a pig to color while waiting to be served. If you appreciate art, you'll enjoy the large number of the pig masterpieces from previous diners on display.
Service was good. Food was pretty standard. Bacon was awesome!

Love the premise of the restaurant: Breakfast, Lunch, Bacon.  Service was poor. We were there the week it opened and were told that we could sit but it would be an hour before we got food. We were not able to stay so we left. I appreciate them giving us a head's up. Then we tried again a week or so later and were seated- no warning about the length of time to be served and it was over an hour before we and several tables around us were served. They offered us a free pastry but did not comp anything off of the bill. That was disappointing. Food was ok. Hopefully they will get it together because I would love to make this place a regular stop. I can see them really making something of the theme buy selling bacon themed items like bacon popcorn, bacon band aides, bacon scarves, bacon wallets, bacon lamps, etc...a little bacon shop within the place.

Eh- went there today and stood at the front to be seated for too long with no one acknowledging me! I almost left because no one came, finally someone said she'd be right with me. The customer service was just not there today! Also my French toast combo was a little expensive for not looking like a lot of food!

I've been to this location twice. The first time was pretty good, but the second time all of the food at my table was significantly overdone. First time here would have ranked 4 stars, and the second time here ranks 2 stars. I figured I would average it out at 3 stars overall. Not too bad, but consider trying Snooze AM if you are looking for a place to grab brunch.

Three stars because it was average.  I loved the idea of this place, and thought it would be fun to try. Well, it was average.  I got a half flight of bacon (4 pieces - applewood, honey, sugar and apple cider). The only one that tasted any different from its brothers was the apple cider. I'm not sure if I actually liked it or just likes the fact it didn't taste the same.  I got the bacon benedict. It looked good, and the hash towns weren't bad (if very plain). The bacon was very hard, and the sauce was way too thick. It was also honestly kind of tasteless. My mother and daughter both had French toast and enjoyed it, however.  Just for fun we ordered a bacon donut on our way out. Granted I didn't eat it until a few hours after we'd left (kids, whatcha gonna do?), but I didn't find it very good either. Not much taste, very dense.

I would probably only give this place two stars. I came for breakfast with my boyfriend today and neither of us were too impressed.   We started with the flight of bacon. First of all for what you get it's expensive. $8-$9. They all tasted the same except for the peppered bacon somewhat stood out.   I ordered the Arizona omelette because I love chorizo. You literally couldn't even taste or see the chorizo. It seemed like one big blended omelette. Kind of weird. Plus it's SMOTHERED in "ranchero" sauce. It's this dark red thick spicy sauce. I would ask for it on the side if you're going to order it.   My boyfriend got the breakfast burger. He didn't seem too thrilled.   To be honest, I know it's the "oink cafe" but it was almost pork overload. And I don't really enjoy staring at pictures of cute cartoon pigs all over the walls while I eat bacon. Probably won't be returning.

The Boy and I decided to try The Oink after another breakfast place was closed for the holiday and had a Meh experience.  The food was very good.  I enjoyed my Two Egg Plus combo, it was a large amount of food if you find yourself hungry.  I chose scrambled eggs and they were fluffy and buttery.  I chose a biscuit option instead of toast and it was HUGE.  If you are a biscuit and gravy fan, I would suggest going ala cart from the sides menu (one biscuit vs two) as one biscuit split in half would fill and entire plate.    The boy had Huevos Rancheros and was very happy.  He especially liked the ranchero sauce, I had a taste and likened it more to a mole, super dark yet sweet with a hint of heat.  I also tried their classic bloody mary which had more heat than spice.    Where our experience was lacking was the service.  Our server did not check on us once after we got our food and we had to flag her down to get to go box after she dropped the check and left while I was asking for a box.  My two egg plus combo came with choice of bacon but my server didn't ask what kind I wanted and I forgot it was an option. Seems like this would be front and center for a server since the 8 kinds of bacon are listed all over the menu and walls.  We also weren't given straws for our drinks (including the bloody mary) while all other tables had them in all their drinks. Our drinks were never refilled and one attempt was made to refill my coffee five minutes after I got it.   The hostess and busser staff needs some training.  During our 20 min wait at any given time, there were 4 or 5 tables empty waiting to be seated or waiting to be cleared.  There was a wait-list of 8 parties waiting to be seated during that time with open tables so revenue was being missed with that many open tables.  I also saw hostesses walk by tables full of dirty dishes and not touch a single dish.   I do want to give props to the patrons.  A gentleman was going to eat breakfast alone and was waiting for a table when a table of two asked if he wanted to join them instead of waiting and dining alone.  Awesome.

This place is unique to sum it up in one word. Great, random selection of bacon goodness. I actually prefer this over the larger, chain-type cafes and diners but they're only open til 3 :/. Very good prices, great staff, great selection again, good parking and location.

Tempted to give only 2 stars but the sonoran hot dog I had the first time i stepped foot into Oink saved them.  I have been here twice. First time was was shopping at Target and my wife wanted to stop in and get an iced coffee. Got denied as the espresso machine was already off and cleaned for next days use. Manager gave use a coupon for two free specialty drinks so that was very thoughtful. While checking out the place I noticed a special on the wall and it was a sonoran hot dog. For 6 bucks I got the bacon wrapped dog, side of fries, and roasted jalapeno, Serrano, and onion. Great presentation and excellent taste. This was a 3-4 star visit although not getting what we came in for the sonoran hot dog saved the day.  2nd trip. Went in for breakfast wielding our 2 free specialty drink coupons. Waitress took our drink order (two iced americano's) and they came out hot. No biggie lets order food. Waitress' customer service skills were that of a high school kid at his first job. Lady was very blunt and did not act like she cared. Food came out to order but the frozen hash browns were over cooked and couldn't get a water refill.   Had the maple glazed bacon donut and it was basically a sugar cake glazed in maple with bad n bits on top. nothing special.  3 stars and will try this place again eventually.
I need to come back and try the other menu items.   But come on an 8 piece flight of different bacons. You can't go wrong.

Loved every minute of being in here! I had a two-hour window between appointments in the area and decided to stop in to kill time. Thankfully, they have wifi!  I told my server upfront that I'd be hanging out for a bit and to keep the coffee coming. She did! With a name that includes "oink," you should already know that this place is centered around bacon. I however, did not partake of the bacon -- not my cup of tea. Yeah, yeah, yeah....I'm THAT girl who walks in and orders a veggie omelet with more veggies on the side. They accomodated me just fine and didn't give me any weird looks for not ordering bacon.  The gals at the table next to me ordered a bacon donut for dessert. So this is an option if your bacon appetizer and bacon entree aren't enough.  Five stahs!

I went back to Oink this morning since I was in that neighborhood. I must say, it was much better than last time! They have updated the menu and added some new items. I tried the pork confit benedict. It was pretty delish. The pork was falling apart and had delicious flavor, the eggs were cooked perfectly, and the sauce was good too. Definite winning dish. The BF got the bacon pancakes again this time, and he said they were also much better. The batter tasted more homemade versus batter from the box. The prices are still a touch high, in my opinion, but I would definitely go back here because the food was very good. Nice job Oink!
I really enjoyed the breakfast.  I'll defintely will be back for the burgers and different bacon flavors. Mmmmmm

The PV Mall area is in desperate need of a good breakfast joint. You can get Matt's if you go downtown and there are now multiple Over Easy's around the east valley. Unfortunately, this place isn't it. I'm wondering if the 5 star reviews have this place mixed up with another place. Let me first say I think they are trying but if you are bold enough to have a "Bacon Lovers Entrance" then you better deliver. Everyone was friendly and we seated promptly. My boy had the kids pigs in a blanket and I had the two egg breakfast.   Before I jump ahead I should back up a bit. Coffee... I love good coffee and for $2.29 I expect some tasty premium coffee. No such luck. Burnt and rather acidic this is the kind of swill you get at Denny's. Am I being too picky if I don't like to have the little Shamrock farms containers on the table?  Fresh cream please. You are competing to be the go to breakfast place for the neighborhood.   Back to the food. My 2 eggs, over medium, were serviceable and prepared as expected.  The hash browns were super salty and even the egg yolk couldn't make them tasty. Not good at all. I had the applewood smoked bacon. I got 2 flimsy pieces that probably were cooked 4 or 5 hours ago and were burnt around the edges. They were also appeared to be about 1/2 the size of a normal piece of bacon. This is a bacon place and you serve this?  My Kirkland Signature precooked bacon at home placed in the oven for 10 minutes is way better. Seriously how can you serve this?  English muffin was OK. Everything probably sat for 5-7 minutes before it got to me. Not cold but not just off the griddle either. My son's "Pigs in a Blanket" we're worse. The pancakes were crumbly like a biscuit. They had a strange consistency that really was like a sweet biscuit. The Pigs inside of the blanket were of the Brown N Serve variety or whatever the food supply company sells as a equivalent. Really not good.   How do you call yourself The Oink Cafe and serve these pork abominations?  I know their trying to give you a quality experience but with the pork products they're serving I don't think they are going to be around.

I wanted to like this place so bad!  I like the concept behind it, I like the decor, the name and the idea behind the flight of different flavored bacon.  Unfortunately, this establishment fell short of all expectations.   Went in a group of 3 on Sunday for brunch.  2 of us ordered 2 eggs any style + bacon and the third ordered a BLT.  Despite the simplicity of our orders we still had to wait 40-50 minutes for food. That's pretty much where the disappointment begins:  - several tables that were seated after us, got their food before us.  - they forgot to bring my place setting a couple of times - Ordered has browns extra crispy.  They weren't crispy, they were just cold when they arrived =( -they forgot my english muffin -the Jalepeno bacon I was super excited about, tasted like.. regular unflavored bacon.. and it was soggy =/.   For a place named Oink, at the very least you'd expect the bacon to be good right? wrong =/.  I wouldn't come here for food again, but maybe alcohol haha.  Their alcohol is pretty cheap: $4/5 mimosas and bloody maries w/ bacon, $2.50 beer.

Been here a couple times, Food has never been great just good breakfast dining. I do feel that it has dropped a little in quality management as my hash browns were over cooked and the bacon was a little soggy.  Service was fast and friendly and responsive to questions.

Sunday brunch made delicious.  The wait at 11 am on a Sunday morning was long but worth it.  I had the Pork Confit Benedict. The pork was amazingly juicy and flavorful and not at all overpowered by the hollandaise sauce.  My wife had the Oink Omelette which was massive (with 5 eggs) but delicious with bacon, ham, and sausage.  Reasonably priced for the quality and service.  I would definitely eat here again.

This was a great place for breakfast! The bacon was particularly interesting at they had different types and you could get a "bacon flight" of all the varieties. French Toast was divine and breakfast in general was good.
I just moved to this area and we tried this place out. Nothing special and I have definitely experienced better.  Service is so so

Well... with a name like Oink, I expected a cute place full of piggies, bacon infused items, and smokehouse smells.  With fun outdoor windows with cute quotes like... "warning: bacon smell is imminent" I hoped for another breakfast joint to add to our local list of favorites like Chez Vous.  Unfortunately, the food did not stand out by any measure.  We sat outside at a wonderful table smelling some scrumptious things from inside.  After looking thoroughly over the menu, we decided we had to try plates with bacon and sausage, signatures off their name, right?  We ordered the Oink Burger - a HUGE sausage patty with hashbrowns and a fried egg on top of a bun - and 2 eggs with hashbrowns, toast, and the applewood bacon.  Now if you're like me, you're envisioning thick, smoked bacon and flavorful sausage.  After waiting for the food to arrive, we held our opinions until after tasting the food.  The bacon had a nice flavor, but was very thin and overcooked.  The Oink burger had the makings of a winner, but the almost 2" sausage patty had no flavor and so bland I cut it in half to make a thinner patty.  I think the best thing on the plate was the hashbrowns.    Our waitress was very nice even though she had so many tables to serve she was not able to provide refills on our drinks - something we can easily overlook.  I REALLY wanted to love this place... Sadly we didn't find enough amazing differentiators or flavors to drive us back.  I suggest the owners go visit some smokehouses in the south - like Loveless Cafe in Nashville - and bring us some new award worthy dishes!

Great BLT. So-so, perfunctory service. Hadn't been here before so when I walked in I stood at what I learned is their to-go counter for a good solid 90 seconds before anyone acknowledged me. There were six people behind the counter, & not one gave me eye contact or a simple hello. SIX. Not a good first impression. Once I was told to go ahead & take a seat a young lady dropped off a menu & silverware rollup. She said nothing, did not offer water or tell me my server would be right with me. I realize this is a very casual place but still, when guests are tipping for service it should be welcoming & attentive at the very least.  Food is pretty much what I expected. BLT was great--nice & big, delicious bacon (good thing since this is what they're supposed to be known for!). I added avocado which was fresh and tasty. Fruit salad was the generic pineapple, underripe honeydew, grape combo... but even at The Phoenician the fruit is this way!  Overall, good food, but after tax I wouldn't come & spend $11+ on a BLT (and that's without the avocado). Decent atmosphere, despite the bright yellow & green walls and very harsh fluorescent lighting. Very cute patio.
Our server Jossie helped show us the secrets to getting the most out of our visit at Oink. We loved the bacon, but the service was better! Will definitely be back and bring more friends!

This is 100% my new breakfast spot for quick and easy breakfast brunch. They serve breakfast all day. Nice atmosphere. Good size patio. Very nice staff and waiters. Whether your coming in for a quick bite or sitting and being served this is a great option.
Friendly, attentive staff. Above average food. Consistent experience. These are the kinds of places we need. I've been here 10 times and look forward to coming here again.

Their devotion to the pork isn't quite what I anticipated, but The Oink Cafe has some pretty solid breakfast food. A group of us went here because my friend CJ said he thought of me every time he passed this restaurant on his way home from work. [For whatever reason, I've become synonymous with pigs and their meat. Go figure.]  I ordered the pancakes with a side of bacon. Both were really good. As a goof, I showed our server my bacon armband tattoo and she immediately brought the owner over to see it. She took a picture of it and our group, then ordered a flight of bacon for us, on the house. I especially like the jalapeño bacon. But, let's face it. Bacon is like sex: even if you don't think you want it, it's still good; you can almost certainly make time for it; and it's best when enjoyed in the company of friends.
Bacon is awesome but place is too crowded and busy. The Omelet is also pretty good. If you look for bacon, this is the place to be.

So we came to this restaurant when it first opened a few years ago.  We were not impressed because they were so unorganized and quite frankly, the food was not that great.  Fast forward to present day and since we were at Target, we thought we would give this place another try and see if it has improved.  So glad we did!!  I LOVE eggs benedict and it's so hard to find a place that serves it just right - where the poached egg is perfectly done so that the yolk explodes into yumminess when you poke into it.  This place has it down to a science.  I have had their eggs benedict every time we have been back (4 times since) and I have yet to be disappointed.  The service is also great!  I do have to say the bacon itself still has much to be desired.  I'm not a huge fan because their bacon is really thin...but the eggs benny?  YUMMM.

Sunday morning around 10am, first time here. I've been meaning to come here for years. It was a full house but we got a booth right away. I ordered the Flight of bacon and Chicken California omelette with English muffin, hash brown potatoes and coffee. Our waitress was friendly and service was very fast. The omelette was very good. The Flight of bacon was 8 strips of all their flavors of bacon. I thought 5 out of the 8 strips of bacon tasted the same. The jalapeño, pepper and pecanwood bacon were distinguishable and tasty. The rest were just bacon flavored to me. It was all good, will have to come back again to sample more of the menu.       Came back a second time for lunch. This time it was about 1:15, they close at 2. The place was half full. I ordered the 50/50 burger with cheese and sweet potato fries. It took little longer for our food this time. The burger and fries were very good.The burger was flavorful and the sweet potato fries were salted just right and crispy. Decent service

Had lunch with my wife at the Oink Cafe in Paradise Valley. We started with the Flight of Bacon platter, eight different flavors of bacon. For entrees, we had the bacon pancakes and the 50/50 burger, 50% beef / 50% bacon with a side of fries. For dessert, we enjoyed bacon donut holes, pretty much the best baked treat I've ever had! Service was excellent (Thanks, Lana!) and we enjoyed our meal greatly! Also, there is a Half-Price Books right next door, highly recommended!!

Chose this restaurant because I like the name. Service was great but food was just ok. I had the Huevos Ranchero. The red sauce was overwhelming with chili powder flavor and salt. Waffle good. Husbands omelet was greasy and salty.
Poor service and old coffee I asked if they had fresh coffee. Seemed insulted that I asked. Will not return
